description:
Skill and artistry alone - I'm so awed.
Everyone is an artist in his or her own right!
I was blown away by a simple yet skillful and creative method of serving ice cream.
author: Leslie S.

description:
I've been here twice and I really want to like STEEP, but there's been something a bit off each time. Maybe I'm just ordering the wrong things?

The first time I got the strawberry pom creama with agar boba and 0% sugar. I'm used to getting 0% sugar with fruit teas because usually the fruit syrup is sweetened, but it was a huge mistake this time. The whole drink tasted watery and flavorless and the cream didn't mesh well with the strawberry. 

The second time I got the mango coconut smoothie - also just weirdly flavored and not quite right. I feel like it would be hard to mess up mango chunks and coconut cream, but it didn't taste at all like I imagined.

I'll probably come back to try the matcha drinks or rolled ice cream, but it's been a miss for me so far.
author: Katy Y.

description:
A rather disappointing experience here. I've had rolled ice cream before at other places and was looking forward to trying STEEP after seeing reviews, but I don't think it's worth coming here a second time.

The descriptions of the rolled ice creams all sound delicious and I had a hard time choosing which one to try. I ended up picking the Coffee Meets Waffle: Andytown Roaster coffee mixed with waffle and coffee beans, topped with house whip and coffee beans - sounds delicious right? Sadly, the ice cream itself was quite icy and flavorless, with barely any hint of coffee. I forced myself to finish it because it was $7+, but the only part I really liked was the housemade whipped cream. 

I tried a bit of the Salted Caramel Pretzel as well and it was a bit better than the Coffee Meets Waffle - or at least, it had some salted caramel pretzel flavor.

Free toppings is a nice gesture. I got almond flakes and fresh fruits, which they put on the side in a little cup so that it wouldn't fall off the ice cream. (The fruits were not very ripe or sweet either though.)

My sister also got the passion fruit aloe tea, which was supposed to come with passionfruit seeds; however, there were clearly no passionfruit seeds in her drink, and when she asked the staff working behind the counter, they said there weren't supposed to be any. Why list the passionfruit seeds on the menu then? Also just a warning that this drink is extremely sweet and they said they could not adjust the sweetness for it, so we ended up mixing in a ton of water to dilute it.
author: Ivonnie S.

description:
Best rolled ice cream in SF! 

I love watching them make each order, and the menu is constantly updated. The last time I was there, some flavors included Mocha JavaScript and C++ Dutch Chocolate, I kid you not. Welcome to SF!!

Anyways, I love all of their matcha options and also the Original Oolong, which I got with grass jelly and matcha boba (they were out of regular boba.) my friend got Matchapolis which was matcha and sesame rolled ice cream with strawberries and matcha boba. They get so creative! 

Using Straus Creamery (the milk Boba Guys uses) makes the rolled ice cream smooth, creamy, and rich. 

The decor is very cute and they know you may be going there for the 'gram--there's cute quotes on the walls, plants, and a box to put your rolled ice cream for a picture! 

Friendly, helpful service. I do need to try the boba there but it's so tough when their rolled ice cream is so good! I always go when I visit GitHub but Steep is also right near the ballpark soooo
author: Lizzie S.

description:
3.5/5 Overall
I come here waaay too often since it's the closest boba place to my work. I like their fruit drinks since they use real fruit (fyi the sugar level for the fruit teas is actually the amount of fruit purée they put into the drink, not actual sugar). Go-tos are the Tangerine Kumquat Tea and Strawberry Pom Tea with agar boba. Their milk teas are a little too watery for me so I would stick with their fruit teas. The boba is usually just okay (sometimes it's too hard or not sweetened well) but they don't charge extra for agar boba so that makes up for it. A normal drink comes out to about $5.5 with a topping. I would go to Asha over Steep if it were closer since their teas are better, but convenience usually tends to win out.

I don't normally come here for their rolled ice cream, but my favorite would have to be the oolong one!
author: Alice C.

description: I got the jasmine green milk tea and the actual tea was super watery and tasteless. The boba was decent but I was overall disappointed by the tea. I heard their fruity drinks are better here. The size of the drink is pretty big so it's a decent deal!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I went and tried the boba it was my first time having it so I asked the guy working there what the most popular one was. He was really helpful and recommended the oolong. He asked me how much I like sweetness like how do I drink my coffee. I told him I have a sweet tooth so he used a mid to high sweet level. It was really weird at first with the tapioca bubbles but the flavor was good and the bubbles grew on me. I think I'd try another flavor next time.
author: Alex J.

description:
My thoughts on rolled ice cream is that it is overhyped/ overrated, but I liked STEEP's rolled ice cream! Prices for rolled ice cream are not too bad/ the norm. I like how they use Straus Creamery in the ice cream. :D

I got the matchapolis (sesame and matcha rolled ice cream, topped with strawberry and matcha boba), which was a nice treat. I was mildly amused with the two flavors rolled together. I didn't like the matcha boba- it was super weird, but everything else was good. Not super sweet, and I would come back if I lived in the area!

The drinks are also worth getting.  My roommates got the Legendary Matcha Milk Tea and Vietnamese Coffee with boba, which were both fantastic.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
This business can be creative with the rolled ice cream but the service needs to be improved a lot!!! Service is super slow despite the place is not busy at all!!
Lots of people coming here are working professionals including myself and I can't afford to keep waiting here for a glass of bubble tea!!! WTH?!!!
The 'add ons' is super stingy as well!!! I added the red bean and herbal jelly into my tea and I keep struggling trying to dig into the bean and the jelly!
Can't you guys be reasonable in terms of the 'add ons' portion?? Your price is not even cheaper than any other bubble tea stores out there!
The only positive things about this place is that it is clean and cool.
But again, the wait is ridiculous!
author: Irene X.

description: They do rolled ice cream desserts here with fresh fruit toppings, really good but a bit pricey ($6.50). I ordered the matcha black sesame latte ($5) and wasn't a fan of it. I normally like black sesame but it needs to be paired with something creamy otherwise the gritty texture just tickles your throat...the soy milk wasn't cutting it, I liked the idea of it but it made the drink taste bland and gave it a watered down consistency. So I went back and exchanged it for a different drink using regular milk (they were kind enough to do this free of charge), but the earl grey tea flavor still wasn't very pronounced. I was bummed bc I really love earl grey things. Go for their desserts, pass on the drinks.
author: Cammy C.

description:
Cute little stop in San Francisco with a nice vibe and good staff. The wait was a little long for us, we know that rolled ice cream takes time but it took about 20 minutes with two girls working (there were 5 guests ordering at the same time). Honestly if the ice cream was out of this world I wouldn't mind the wait, but it was kind of just normal ice cream in a fun shape. We tried the matcha and the C++ cocoa. Both were good but maybe not a 20-minute-wait-kind-of-good. 

Might be a fun date stop where the conversation is more important :).
author: Lori M.

description:
Steep is a workday essential where I work! It's about a 2 block walk from our office, and we love it.

They have lots of options here for ice cream rolls. I think my favorite is probably the Thai tea or the strawberry shortcake. I also think it's cute that they name some of their ice cream rolls after software engineering things like C++ or mocha JavaScript. They definitely know their area well! 

They also have tooooons of tea here, so if that's your thing, or you're like me and you love both tea and ice cream, there are plenty of boba options. I really love the lavender earl grey, but you really can't go wrong. They also seem to have a lot of matcha things, but I'm not a matcha connoisseur, so I'm not sure how good they are. 

It's also a pretty small place, but I think you could manage to get some work done if you really had to. To be honest, I don't come to Steep to work so it doesn't bother me, but if you're looking for a place to land for the day to do some serious work, this probably isn't a good place for that.
author: Claire C.

description:
So I'm torn. Their Earl grey lavender boba has great flavor and they can sub out milk for dairy free options... But their boba was not fresh at all... Like hard in the center.

Guess I'll have to try again and see if it was a fluke... Stay tuned.
author: Mandi W.

description: Pumpkin Pie ice cream that is better than Grandma's pie?!?!? Absolutely cheered me up and made my day.  $10.00 with tip... Totally worth it!!
author: barbara e.

description:
This place is tucked away between business and condo buildings. Their ice cream combinations are unique and all sound so appealing it was hard to choose. They also sell boba tea and different types of boba! If you're a matcha fan, this place is heaven. Almost everything on the menu contains matcha! Again, just like the ice cream, it was hard to choose from the milk teas. 
The ice cream was rolled and softer than others I've had but the flavor was all there. The salted caramel pretzel was the perfect balance of salty and sweet. The matcha boba tea was okay mainly because i only got 50% sweetness so it tasted like unsweetened tea. ‍ I'd come back and just get regular boba tea, with all the sweeetness and things. 

Don't pass this one up especially if you like matcha.
author: Jenna T.

description:
This is my neighborhood boba tea/icecream roll spot. Been here several time and they have a great assortment of flavors to choose from! So far I have tried thai iced tea, pure black and oolong with and without boba and its delicious! They can alter the sweetness level for you if you like.

The matcha latte is also pne of my personal favorite if I am in a mood for something warm.

They ice cream flavors are very unique and stand out every time! My favorite is matcha with sesame but this time I tired the C++ dutch chocolate with cocoa bits cream and FREE cheesecake topping. Delicious! 

Highly recommend for your boba/ice cream fix!
author: Nidhi M.

description:
I visited STEEP for the rolled ice cream and it is definitely worth the visit! We tried the green tea and cookies and cream flavors. They were both delicious, but I definitely want to return for many of the other flavors!
Not only was the ice cream delicious, but the service was great. The closing time had changed and was incorrect on Google. We arrived as they were closing and had already turned off the devices the ice cream is rolled on. They were kind enough to stay late an turn the devices back on in order to serve us.
author: Emitom H.

description:
Rolled ice cream is pretty cool, but the storefront itself is a very small space.  There's cute mini photo set ups, ready for your instagram posts. 

ICE CREAM
My Thai
Uji Matcha- no strawberries
Coconut cream- berries on the side; so far this has been my favorite.  Vegan ice cream FTW

They close pretty early on weekdays, just like the rest of SOMA...but it's nice to know you can order online for pick up.  I really want to try the boba and smoothies, but I've only been here for the ice cream.
author: Lyn C.

description:
Steep is located in SoMa and offers delicious drinks and ice cream rolls. Loved their ice cream rolls - so creamy and not overpoweringly sweet! I haven't seen mixed rolls before so had to try both the matcha polis (matcha + sesame) and matcha politan (matcha + strawberry) both topped with regular boba and strawberry. 
Also tried their earl grey lavender and it had a great balance of both flavors. Friend tried the strawberry matcha lemonade and said it was really good as well.
author: Vicky R.

description: When I first saw a photo of their rolled up ice cream, I had to come! The rolled ice cream trend looks so pretty, but it doesn't taste that great. I like the toppings on top, but the ice cream is the part that I wouldn't recommend. It's possible that I just haven't found the one that I like yet. I recommend getting their boba instead. I like that they open late and that the location is convenient for me.
author: Andrea T.

description:
With this summer heat, rolled ice cream is the perfect way to beat the heat!
I got the my Thai with mochi on top - so yummy and definitely hit the spot. 
My little brother also seemed to really like the cookie crush flavor.
The staff was nice and quick to tend to customers,
keep up the good work!
Would definitely recommend if you're in the area or just craving some rolled ice cream. :)
author: Gabby O.

description:
As a founding member of ice creamaholics anonymous, I gotta keep up my addiction to remain in the club. What other reason would I have to visit STEEP 3 times in 1.5 weeks? ;)

Boba: I got the matcha latte and it was probably a 3.25 / 5. The middle of the boba was somewhat hard, but at least they were slightly sweetened. The latte itself was very milky, but could have used some more matcha flavor (sorry I compare everything to Asha's deep green beauties).

Ice cream rolls are cool to look at, but I'm not actually sure they're all that tasty. I've tried the thai tea, oolong, and matcha rolls. The thai tea was true to taste and fairly strong in flavor at that. The oolong was interesting too, but could have used some more flavor. The matcha was less strong in flavor. They tend to crumble if you eat them too soon after they're made, but if you leave them out for too long they melt fairly quickly. The texture doesn't work for me since I like ice cream to be creamy and airy. Given that there aren't any air pockets in these, it's more like eating frozen cream. 3.25 / 5.

Great for an Instagram photo (they even have a little photo booth especially for this purpose)!
author: Nicole H.

description:
I have been there several times and tried different drinks and rolled ice cream. You can't go wrong with any of these flavors.

For the tea, my personal favorite is oblong milk tea with 50% sugar. Oblong tea have stronger aroma than other green or black tea options, which makes the milk tea more enjoyable.

The best thing here is the rolled ice cream. I literally loved all the flavors and toppings. I do hope they offered a smaller cup options so I can be there more often feeling lguilty about all those calories
author: Wenjing Y.

description: A nice treat! The bit of a wait to roll the ice cream is worth it! Staff is friendly and informative. Our favorites are Thai ice cream and Java chocolate. Street parking not a problem if you go on the right day- meaning no events.
author: Jodie S.

description:
Amazing matcha lattes (50% sweet) with quality matcha powder you can taste! Will definitely be back soon. 

Pros
- Strauss milk for ice cream roll ups
- interesting ice cream flavors like for four barrel coffee and black milk tea with a shot of matcha 
- alternative dairy like Califia Almond milk
- interesting toppings including egg pudding 
- great friendly service, no lines 
- easy parking on weekends 
- clean, modern cute location

Cons
- minimal seating, cramped space 
- jasmine milk tea tasted watery 
- boba balls not sweet or chewy enough
author: Jess C.

description:
Well, my rolled ice cream cherry has finally been popped and I'm glad STEEP ceremoniously did the honors. 

While visiting friends in SF, we found ourselves in a bit of a dessert dilemma -- some wanted boba, while others wanted ice cream. At Steep, you can have both your dreams come true AND document it in style... No need to look for that artsy perfect backdrop either, they have their own mini foodie photo-shoot setup! 

Anyway, I was on team ice cream that day, so here are some verdicts:

UJI MATCHA: This was what I chose because I love green tea errthang. It comes with strawberry and red bean toppings. For me, it was a strange experience because it felt like I should be sipping what I was eating. It was a little too rich, so I didn't finish it all. The strawberries were a great complement, but I wasn't a fan of the red bean. 

ORIGINAL OOLONG: My friend's pick. It comes with herbal jelly and boba. I actually liked hers better than mine. The tea flavor was strong but not overpowering, and boba is always a good idea! Tasted refreshing. 

COOKIE CRUSH: My bf's choice, and probably my favorite of the three we ordered. It's a cookies&cream ice cream, with cookie whip, cookie crumbs, and an Oreo. It sounds like a cookie overload, but it was the perfect blend. Not too heavy.

One of our friends had the JASMINE GREEN MILK TEA, but it wasn't a community thing, so I can't say much about it...

SIDE NOTE: There are additional toppings you can add for FREE! If I had known this, I would have been all over that mochi and condensed milk! They also have various fresh fruits, cheesecake bits, dark choco shavings, almond flakes, and organic granola.
author: Kat B.

description:
This is probably the only tapioca shop who has gotten my less boba and extra ice on point in the first try haha so gotta give credit when credit is due

I was ecstatic to find any shop that has lavender anything so it was a must stop for me if I ever stumbled upon the area.

I ordered the earl gray lavender milk tea. the lavender flavor is very strong, so strong the drink did end up tasting like soap lol cup is 24oz - only one size I believe and right around $5.xx range

I'd love to come back and try more of their other drinks if I'm in the area again. they also offer rolled ice cream if you want to try that!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
What is not to love, boba in SOMA, ice cream made to order.

My favorite is their roasted oolong tea, boba, red bean and 25% sweet is all you need
author: Tony T.

description:
Best icicle dessert!! Dont mix this place up with the other Steep near by which doesnt have the icicles. I made that mistake and took my team on a field trip across SOMA. Both locations have milk tea, but only one has ice cream and the other has acai bowls. They have the same name and owner, but could be confusing because some people incorrectly added these photos to the other STEEP location. 

I had the cookies and cream icicle ice cream. The toppings are unlimited and to your choosing. I topped mine with fresh fruit (strawberry, blueberry, and watermelon), boba, condensed milk, cheesecake bites and mochi. Absolutely wonderful! 

Plan to eat there because it melts quickly. They have many flavors to choose from (see menu picture I attached). Not sure if you can mix and match but that would be cool! 

Its a far walk, but I guess I need to work off those calories anyways right? Will definitely be back again soon!
author: Claire W.

description:
This is my new favorite place in town. The black sesame seed rolled ice cream is THE BEST. Great texture, temperature and taste. TTT

You can add unlimited toppings to it, so I always get it with additional mochi, cheese cake bits, and fruits. I'd highly recommend. I've tried the green tea one too, but not as good. I have committed to black sesame seed until I get my 10 stamps. The staff is always friendly there and there is even a little instagram station for you to take some hipster photos and @steep. Tried it for the gram, but not a big hit. The succulents were competing for visual attention.

The space is not too big, but I've never had an issue getting a seat. I can't wait to be back! Don't go to the other one that's like .3 miles away. It is not nearly as good.
author: Juliana P.

description: Delicious ice cream that is not too sweet. I also had a classic boba tea that was good. I really liked the green tea strawberry combo, and my co-worker had the chocolate one that was sweeter. It had this great chocolate mousse that came with it. One downside was that the service was really slow. It took us about 30 minutes to get what we ordered and there were only two or three orders ahead of us. Not a lot of seats at the place either.
author: Xi-Er D.

description:
Aesthetics & Hipster Boba Place? Checked.
Instagram-worthy picture? Checked.
Colorful drinks & Rolled Ice cream? Checked.
Good show of workers rolling the Ice cream? Checked.
Sitting room & Chill area? Checked.

I was in Soma neighborhood to pick up my friend up from Cal-train Station and I suggested to get some boba around the area. I always wanted to try this place and bam! here I am and it was only couple blocks away. We got there around 3pm when there was no line and plenty of sitting area. I ordered Strawberry Matcha Lemonade (4/5 ratings) and it was really pretty with triple layers of color. I loved the aesthetic-ness and picture-worthy of the cup. The drink itself was good, but I wasn't extremely satisfied with the drink. It came out a little sour to drink and kind of heavy on the bitterness of the matcha.

 They have a mini photo booth backdrop that lets you take pictures of your drinks with good lighting. We were chilling for a bit and all the sudden the line got longer. So it does get a little crowded in Steep. Next time, I might try the rolled ice cream!
author: Judy M.

description:
My friend and I got here 15 minutes before closing and were met with amazing service. The staff is cheerful and welcoming, and didn't mind that we stayed a bit after closing.

We ordered the strawberry cheesecake rolled ice cream, and added some extra topping with no additional cost! The ice cream itself was creamy and flavorful, and we could taste the freshness of the strawberries.

Great food and atmosphere! Definitely worth the price.
author: Lilith H.

description:
I've been to STEEP twice now and I'd say they have some of the best prepared teas (boba or not) in SF. 

Yesterday I tried the Chrysanthemum Tea with Honey recommended by the owner, and it was amazing! The fragrance of chrysanthemums was fully extracted but not overpowering. (It can get bitter if you over-extract.) The amount of Honey was on point.

The quality of their tapioca is consistently good, which can't be taken for granted because a lot of boba shops are either sloppy or too cheap to cook them fresh. I always give shops who do it right bonus points.

I haven't tried the ice cream rolls yet. Guess that's what I'll get next time!
author: Joseph L.

description:
I LOVE ice cream and this place makes the rolled up ice cream pretty well. It was my first time trying the rolled ice cream. I ordered the oreo one with mochi and fruit. It is so cool that we get to watch the process of them making the ice rolls. Rolled up ice cream is definitely not as creamy as regular ice cream, but it was still a cool experience. I believe the price was only $6 for this with unlimited toppings, which is not too bad for ice cream in SF. 

Also, this place has a booth set up for you to take your photos for Instagram, which is a pretty smart idea. I heard about this place on Instagram because of this booth. I'm glad I saw this and tried the rolled up ice cream here. I think it's definitely made well and worth it.
author: Allyson L.

description:
I gave STEEP's ice cream rolls another try and wow, what an improvement. They now have several ice cream machines and the staff seems to have gotten the hang of making these rolls. 

I like the calming decor of the shop and the variety of flavor combinations. We shared an order of one of their specials - Hokkaido milk tea ice cream rolls with clear boba and cheesecake bites. I also asked them to top it off with fresh blueberries and strawberries. I was very impressed.

I'm so glad STEEP is only a few blocks from the office. It's perfect for an afternoon snack break.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Solid dessert spot for trendy rolled ice cream and milk tea. Steep uses quality tea and ceremonial grade matcha for their ice cream! Also a great spot for Instagram worthy photo ops.

I came to try the matcha rolled ice cream and it definitely impressed. The technique used to prepare the desserts is pretty novel and it's a fun place to get something sweet. I'm not huge on desserts but this place is pretty special. You get free toppings too! Fresh fruits, mochi, cheesecake bits, dark chocolate shavings, almond flakes, organic granola and condensed milk at your disposal.

There's a station to order and then a viewing area to see people making the ice cream. They have lots of flavors: Thai tea, oolong, cold brew, coconut, earl gray, cookies & cream, cheesecake, black sesame, Dutch chocolate and mango.

Ujimatcha - Ceremonial matcha ice cream w/strawberry & red bean. Exceeded expectations! The matcha is no joke here. It tasted like pure matcha flavor and not like the usual ice creams that are more daisy based. We enjoyed it with mochi.

Earl Gray Lavender Milk Tea - So happy to see that they offer non caffeinated drinks here! I got it with almond milk and 0% sweetness. The flavor was great and exactly what I expected.

Love the concept and I don't mind paying around $7 for a koala tea dessert.
author: Chelsea W.

description: OMG! I totally loved mine! The rolls were so tight that it didn't melt right away like some do. And the flavor of thai tea really came thru. I wish there was one in the East Bay! My only gripe is location as it's tough to find parking and it's all metered by the ballpark which means $$$$$.
author: Carolyn S.

description:
I've heard about the rolled ice cream phenomenon and was anxious to try it.  There is no place near my work or home that does it, but thankfully, Steep is close to AT&T Park.  On a Sunday, my wife & I strolled in around noon before a 1:00 PM Giants game.  The place wasn't too busy, and everyone in front of us ordered boba or coffee.  

After looking at the menu on the wall, I selected the My Thai while my wife chose the Silky Sesame.  After ordering, we waited on the side, where the server made the ice cream in front of us.  He poured the liquid mix onto a slab of really cold metal (probably cooled with liquid nitrogen from below the counter).  As the liquid started to solidify, he used two spatulas to shape and form the ice cream.  Once the ice cream gets to the correct temperature and consistency, he shaped it into a very thin square sheet, then used one of the spatulas to scrap the bottom, rolling the ice cream into its signature shape.  The rolls are placed in a bowl, then garnished with the toppings.  

This process took about 5 minutes, and the staff can only roll 3 orders of ice cream at a time, so be prepared to wait a bit if it's busy.  I asked him how long it took to learn how to do this, and he said "way too long!"  I guess I won't be trying this at home anytime soon.

The My Thai has Thai tea ice cream, garnished with boba and coconut pudding.  The Silky Sesame has black sesame ice cream with agar boba and fresh fruit.  One good thing about Asian-style ice creams is that they are not overly sweet.  The coconut pudding and fruit, respectively, offer some extra sweetness, but we never felt we were drowning in sugar.  The My Thai was sweeter than the black sesame, but both were very delicious.  The ice cream also had a dense consistency from the freezing and rolling process.  

You can also get additional toppings on the ice cream at no additional charge, but the flavors we got were perfect.  And we got orange and black ice cream for the Giants, too!  We plan to make this a regular stop for Giants games in the future!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Yay! Finally, ice cream rolls are in SF and within 10 mins walking distance from my boyfriend's place - love it! 

For $6, you get a (small) bowl of ice cream rolls (usually 4 - 5 rolls), with a generous amount of FREE toppings. My favorites are the cheesecake + mochi + boba. I think one bowl for two people is perfect. 

I absolutely loved the black sesame one, and I can't wait to try matcha & pistachio. I will be back :) and try everything on the menu.

P.S. kinda cute (or weird...) that Steep set up an area for your ice cream to be photographed (see my pic) with perfect lighting and cute props.
author: Dana Z.

description:
Really good way to present ice cream! Rolled and not scooped. Foodies would luv the free toppings. 
Yummy teas of various kinds, both sweet and natural. 
Go and enjoy.
author: Albert T.

description:
I was told about this place by one of my co-workers and as I need a break from the office (and it was only a 10 min walk) we stopped by for some boba. 

Since I work on 2nd street, the walk was nice as it was sunny and downhill, but the store front is a little hard to find, as it blends with the surrounding companies in the area. I did find the inside nice looking and wish I could try the rolled iced cream, but as I am lactose intolerance, I could not (maybe they will do coconut milk ones soon).

I ordered a JUST TEA: Jasmine with boba, soy milk, 50% sweet and iced. Overall, it was tasty, but there were certain things that can be improved upon as I grew up in SF, and there are A LOT of boba places. The boba was nice, but few a little more chewy than more and had a off sweet after taste. The tea was nice, but with the soy milk, it was not as milky as it could have been like the non dairy boba's from Sharetea.

Would try them again, but maybe just the tea without boba and milk, as with all that stuff, my boba was over $5.
author: Mei L.

description:
Rolled ice cream is the new hip thing! Been here twice and both items I've tried has been very flavorful. I love their options of rolled ice cream. They also offer boba drinks, but I haven't tried it yet. 

The first time I came I tried the Oolong one which is still my favorite! Love that it comes with the herbal jelly and boba. 

Today, I tried the myThai which comes with coconut pudding and boba. This one has good flavor, but I personally still prefer the oolong. 

I would definitely come back to try their other flavors (esp. the coffee one and the black sesame one).
author: Karen Y.

description:
Recently, I've been really into ice cream.  It's the perfect dessert after every meal and since the sun has blessed us with its presence lately, it's a great treat to cool the body down.  STEEP has been making a big name for themselves with their refreshing drinks and now, with the new ice cream roll up craze, STEEP has mastered this dessert as well.  

MyThai - the roll ups had a nice texture and the thai tea flavor was noteable.  The coconut pudding complemented the thai tea.  The boba was a tad undercooked

Friendly service
author: Linda N.

description:
I ordered the "legendary matcha milk tea" with boba, which was $5.50, but sadly, the matcha tasted very powdery and weak. Other places offer matcha milk tea that has a much stronger matcha flavor and where the matcha is also much better mixed. Honestly, I wouldn't recommend the matcha tea/milk tea here.

I also saw several people order the ice cream rolls, which looked cool, but for $6, was a terribly small portion size (the recent bowl looks even smaller than the ones I've seen in pictures). I thought other places were expensive, but the bowl here was tiny and there were hardly any toppings (other places allow unlimited toppings). Caveat: I didn't order it myself, so I cannot speak to the taste.

They have a few small tables, a few benches both inside and outside, and one gender-neutral bathroom. They are located in a small suite in the Splunk building (the main entrance is just next door). Staff was generally friendly, but seemed a bit impatient with us when trying to figure out what to order. After 5pm, it got super crowded, so expect to take it to-go or need to sit on the benches outside. 

All in all, okay boba and dessert place, but it wouldn't be my go-to. Prices seem kind of steep for the quality you get and the matcha did not stand out to me.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Welcome to SOMA! Apparently roll ice cream is now the "thing". I had them in NYC and cities around the bay and I think Steep is pretty good. Better than most places in the bayarea but not as good as NYC. I wish they have more flavors. I got the oolong milk tea, my favorite milk tea drink ever. The ice cream was very smooth and rich. $6 dollars, comes with toppings and don't forget to add fruits, no extra cost. Small but I think its the perfect size. They also serve boba drinks as well. I would need to try that next time. The store is bright, clean and service was nice. 

Also, they have a instagram set up for those who wants that perfect pictures.
author: Sandy B.

description:
Novelty of rolled ice cream is cool and they have funny flavor names. Line can get long even on Sunday afternoons in a particularly dead part of soma. The bowls deteriorate pretty quickly though so there's that. Presentation was overall nice and seating inside was limited but most ice cream places are like that.

EDIT - plus, FREE UNLIMITED TOPPINGS!! go ham.
author: RachEl L.

description:
Alright, this place is really closer to a 3/5 if we're just rating the quality of the boba drinks themselves. I've had better, and in the bay, you have a lot of options.
But this place is close to work, quite decent, and the staff is always super friendly and they get your drinks out quickly.

I've never had a *bad* drink here -- nothing has really wowed me, but I'm pretty happy coming here when the boba cravings hit.

As always, 100% sweetness is probably a little too much; I go with 25-50% but I've found that it's not entirely consistent between drinks. I usually stick to the fruit teas, and I'd have to say the mango is one of the best!

They also have rolled ice cream here, which I still need to try!
author: Gautam G.

description:
Nothing beats ice cream on a warm/hot day, especially when the ice cream doesn't melt right away! Came here with a friend on Saturday afternoon at 4pm. There were about five people who ordered before us and we had just beat the mad rush. 

Choices of different flavored ice cream rolls and drinks. We both got the ujimatcha that came with red bean and strawberries. We asked nicely for mochi (yep, there is a sign that says free topping, please ask nicely). The matcha ice cream was flavorful and coooold. A bit hard in texture but I didn't mind it since the ice cream doesn't melt as fast. Red bean was sweet, a good balance to the cold. Mochi was good. Strawberries were cut a bit thin, but I'm ok with that. All presented nicely in a cup- IG worthy. :)

Service
There were three people preparing the orders, two of them making the ice cream rolls and one adding the toppings. Yes, it took some time to get our order, but the air conditioning was strong. 

Other
There is a cute instagram set up with lighting for anyone who wants to use it to take photos- cute idea. Parking was not difficult as long as you're willing to walk a block or two. Additional flavors (not on menu) of ice cream rolls such as sesame, ube, etc available posted on the bottom of the menu.
author: Iris H.

description:
Rolled ice cream!  I tried the My Thai with coconut jello, boba and I added mochi balls.  Additional add-ins are free!  To be honest, this is my first time trying rolled ice cream, so I have nothing to compare it to, but this ice cream was delicious!  

They also have various teas and milk tea that I didn't try but look good too.  

This place is clean, with a few tables to sit at and benches out in front.  They were not very crowded when I went, so I didn't have to wait very long.  I assume if it's crowded it will take awhile for the ice cream as the process takes some time while they wait for it to harden.
author: Christina C.

description:
It took me a year to visit Steep in spite it being down the street from my house.  

I think it was just a little too hipster looking for me.  Finally went down to try it with a friend, and the quality was about what I expected.  I got the roasted oolong milk tea and added crema.  Though my drink had the addition of both milk and cream, I couldn't really taste either.  There was too much water in the tea, and it just seemed to dilute everything (the taste of the tea, milk, and cream).  It was all right, but for $5 I would want something a little more refined.  The crema itself was also not very rich and could have used more salt.

Tips and Tricks
-Okay this is a weird one, but that strip of Brannan is frequented by dog walkers so watch out for poop!
-Rolled ice cream offerings were extensive, and there are plenty of things you can add into your mix
-They have a light box set up so you can get that perfect Instagram shot!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Pretty good but very tiny storefront. So if you have more than 2 people then I would suggest you plan to grab n go.

Their mocha ice cream rolls were pretty tasty. I substituted the jelly for coconut pudding which was a good choice.

There's about 5 tables available but really small ones so I don't recommend this place if you plan to do some work on your laptop. 

This location is slightly different from thw other one close by. This is the one that offers ice cream rolls, not acai bowls/cups. The main way to know is that this location says Creamery in the title but the other one doesn't.

The quality is there so I will be back again to try more items. I'm curious about their mango mousse.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Want some dessert? COME HERE! Both ice cream & bubble tea are worth it!

Rolled ice cream - not just a fad but actually really delicious & I love the denser, harder texture! (Steep Creamery is also much better than NY's 10 Below, much better flavors!) 

We ordered the Coffee Meets Waffle with the FREE toppings of mochi and fresh fruits. The first bite, we were thinking "oh it's pretty normal..." but the more you eat, the better it gets! The ice cream is so cold that it doesn't melt too fast which is awesome. 

I really appreciate that the ice cream and toppings here are not too sweet and are all natural ingredients. I also like that there are unique flavors such as oolong and black sesame! Can't wait to try all the different flavors.

Bubble Tea - we ordered the Jasmine Green Milk Tea with Boba and the tea isn't too sweet at 75% sugar. There could be more boba but not complaining too much since the boba is perfectly chewy.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Rohenne L.

description:
**3.5 stars**

I came here primarily because I wanted to try their oolong ice cream rolls! It comes with boba and herbal jelly, but there are additional toppings that you can ask them to put on your ice cream, for free. At $6 a cup, there's only 5 (sometimes 4 and a half) rolls of ice cream. It's less than what other ice cream roll shops give you, but they don't skimp on the toppings. I had way more toppings than ice cream and I found myself eating boba and mochi long after I finished my ice cream. I could taste the oolong flavor in the ice cream but it didn't really 'wow' me. My boyfriend got the cookie crush flavor which came with whipped cream and an oreo. He forgot to ask for more toppings so his was a bit boring, lol.

It's a bit pricy and the ice cream wasn't as good as Icicles, but I really liked how they have "Asian" style toppings like boba, jellies/pudding, and mochi. The shop is small so there isn't any table seating, but there are chairs on the side to sit while you wait for your ice cream. I also thought it was super cute how they had a little table set up for a mini photoshoot for your ice cream, complete with a backdrop and lighting! Overall, it's a decent place for ice cream rolls and I probably would come back if I'm around the area to try their MyThai and Uji Matcha flavors.
author: Cecille W.

description:
My first rolled ice cream experience. Surprise surprise.. it tastes just like regular ice cream with an added mesmerizing, insta-worthy factor. Fresh ingredients and good amount toppings. Probably better described as the asian version of cold stone ice cream

The drinks were good, not amazing. Couldn't really taste any sweetness in the matcha latte at 50%. I was confused by all the type of matcha drinks, so here's the breakdown. Old fashioned matcha = matcha, water. Matcha latte = matcha, milk. Matcha milk tea = matcha, milk, tea

Entrance is a little hidden so just look for the long line (located next to Splunk Inc). I can only imagine how long it would take to get ice cream here in the summer since each order takes about 2-4 minutes to make.
author: Betty C.

description:
Just half a block away from where I live, this place can be dangerous. 

I got the silky sesame ice cream roll and it was extremely sesame-y!!! Most of the time, when you order matcha or sesame flavored ice cream, it usually tastes diluted or not intense enough for my taste but this place does a really good job on making sure the flavors are strong. 

Will definitely be coming back to this place a lot!
author: Mai W.

description:
Loved the rolled ice cream here! This was only my second time trying rolled ice cream, but the rolls here were much better than the ones I had the first time around.

STEEP offers ice cream rolls in 5 different flavors. Each cup is $6 and is made with Straus milk and raw sugar. The flavors are as follows:

MyThai - Thai tea ice cream topped with boba and housemade coconut pudding
Ujimatcha - matcha ice cream topped with fresh strawberry and reb mean
Original oolong - organic oolong tea ice cream topped with boba and housemade herbal jelly
Cookie crush - crushed chocolate cookie ice cream topped with housemade cookie and whipped cream
Cereal Coder - mystery cereal ice cream topped with cereal and crushed waffle cone

In addition to the toppings that come with each flavor, they also offer free toppings of: fresh fruits, mochi, cheesecake bits, and dark chocolate shavings.

My friend and I split the oolong, which despite my initial reservations about the herbal jelly, ended up being really good. The jelly is almost flavorless, and eating it with a spoonful of the ice cream was nice as it provided a smooth contrast (texture-wise) to the ice cream in my mouth. 

The ice cream itself was creamy and had the texture of normal ice cream instead of the brittle ice cream rolls I had previously experienced. They advertise their ice cream as being made from high quality ingredients and you can definitely tell as you're eating it.

You have to be patient waiting for your ice cream order, though. Because they are handmaking each rolled ice cream to order, it can take a while for your order to be ready. We probably waited a good 20 minutes if not more for our order.

Parking in the area is fairly easy on the weekend; there were multiple open spots along the street when we went on a Sunday afternoon. They were metered but I didn't have to pay because it was Sunday.
author: Dianna H.

description:
I was just talking to my husband about how amazing these "stir fried" yogurt was on the street of Philippines the other day, then I found this spot. Instead of yogurt, they use ice cream liquid batter. 

The wait is really long because this is legit small batch, hand made, and dairy free ice cream (typical SF hipster stuff =]). People seems to complain about the $6 price tag. I actually think it's very reasonable considering the amount of manual labor to hand turn these babies. 


We ordered six flavors: MyThai, oolong, cookies, strawberry cheesecake, sesame, and pistachios. MyThai and strawberry were A+ perfection. Oolong, cookies, and pistachio were a solid B+ (flavor wasn't very strong but still good), sesame is a C(I'm not too crazy about the texture nor the agar boba). Their drinks are also amazing, and fresh. Fruit lemonade had real fruit in it. 

Tips:
1. Wait for a minute or two after the rolls are made to allow them to soften. Otherwise you won't able to scoop with your spoon.
2. Order pick up because it takes 2 minutes for each cup to be made.  
3. They offer unlimited toppings, I asked my cups to  be filled with mochi, and filled with Mochi they were.
author: Tata X.

description:
Unique concept for ice cream being freshly made and rolled up into rolls!  You get to see how they make it in open, public display. 

They have tea and boba drinks on a simple menu.  I opted on their MyThai Ice Cream and one gets to choose toppings!  It includes coconut pudding, which was a sweet surprise that complimented with Thai milk tea flavor.  I chose boba, fresh fruits and chewy mochi.  The whole small dessert cup was packed with jumbo delight!

See-through big windows and metal stools for seating.  No tables.

Contemporary and hipster vibe.  There is even a photo booth right where one would pick up their order.  It gave me an implication to take snapshots of my ice cream rolls with succulents in the background and the name of the place with a hashtag behind it.  Good digital marketing to pass the word along to try this place out!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Was super excited to try this place. Got tired of those "boba guys" all over the city.

Love how they have tea and thai style ice cream. I came hear with the thought of getting the legendary matcha milk tea but somehow I ended with the Earl Grey lavender milk tea. I regret my decision. I don't like flowery flavors but I love earl grey so I thought it would be good. Tea flavor is great but that lavender killed it for me. I think it might be an okay ice cream flavor but not in the tea in my opinion. I'd definitely be back though and probably try the ice cream next time as summer is around the corner.

PARKING: Obviously it's the city so parking will always an itch so no other comments about that. 

VIBE: It is in a very neat area and the store is very clean and spacious. Nice contemporary place to sit around and enjoy your tea or ice cream.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Love love love this placeee! 
So happy there is finally an ice cream shop in SF that makes rolled ice cream & I'm even happier about the flavors they have to offer!

I was super excited to see that they have oolong flavored ice cream! It tastes just like milk tea--for all you milk tea lovers. They use real tea and I really felt the caffeine kick in after finishing the whole cup. Loved their toppings! I got herbal jelly, boba, mochi and honeydew, which all went well with the oolong ice cream. :)
I also got to try my friend's Uji Matcha ice cream and it was so good.... very high quality matcha and I'm very particular when it comes to matcha because it can sometimes be too powdery or bitter. 

It's was also very entertaining watching them make the ice cream because it freezes right away! You can also ask them to chop up the strawberries into your matcha ice cream, which I will definitely be trying next time.

Anyways, I highly recommend this place. Prices are reasonable and they also offer boba drinks and coffee! I can't wait until my next visit already. :)
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Came here this past weekend and thought it was okay.  It definitely is different.  Location was under a business building and not really a high walking traffic area.

When I walked in, didn't know where to order.  There was workers but nobody said where to order.  I think they should have a sign above that says "order here" so people are not so confused.  I saw other line up by the display as they were confused too.

Anyways. I got the oolong tea ice cream roll which I thought was very flavorful.  I tried my friend's mint condition and reminded me of toothpaste..it was just not the right mint to duplicate.  

Overall, it was fine but don't think I would go out of my way to go here.  Also, I think the staff should be more upbeat and friendly to give a good customer experience.
author: James L.

description:
I've been so excited to try new things year after year!  Take frozen treats for instance; starting from shave ice to shave snow.  This year, a new form of frozen treat has entered the spotlight.  I couldn't wait any longer, so I had to check it out.

Before I quickly wrapped up my rainy Easter Sunday, I came all the way to the almost deserted Brannon st. which was few blocks close to AT&T Park.  And there it is, STEEP Tea and Creamery!  You have the very same STEEP Tea café that makes tea lattes, milk teas, and coffees; in addition to what would be the new concept of a frozen treat.  Say hello to the rolled ice cream!  Looks quite similar to rice sheets (if you take away the r from the word "ice").

I'm glad the new creamery opened on weekends, and many people came here, but other patrons were still into bubble teas.  Shouldn't they supposed to go for ice rolled version of the boba drinks instead?  Pour the contents into the ice tray, mash them to bits, smear them thin like a cement, and chisel them into rolls.  There you have it, five frozen rolls with boba toppings, just how I pictured it!  I admit, workers have chiseled slowly; however, steadiness is what makes a good rolled ice cream.  

STEEP Tea and Creamery shall be one of the best places to have rolled ice cream!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Steep literally just opened across the street from my work and I've visited 4 times in a span of a week already. Talk about dangerous!

My favorite drink here is the Mango Green Tea with Lychee Jelly. It's so refreshing and the lychee jelly has a nice chewy texture. The ice cream rolls here is also worth trying and they offer plenty of flavors including cookies & cream and green tea. You can also top your ice cream rolls with Matcha Pudding & Boba. It's an amazing combo and my coworkers are obsessed!

Before this place opened, my coworkers and I would pay tons of money to Postmates to get Boba Guys delivered. Looks like we won't need to get boba delivered anymore since Steep is literally a 2 minute walk from the office. This place also has a rewards system. Buy 10 drinks and get 1 free. What a great incentive!
author: MyTien P.

description:
I LOVE Steep. So when I found out they recently opened a new location AND serve rolled ice cream..?! Take my money, Steep. All of it. 

I recently tried Icicles in SJ and fell in love with rolled ice cream. STEEP Creamery & Tea is the first in SF to have it so I'm glad I don't have to venture all the way to South Bay to get my fix. If ice cream isn't your thing, don't worry they have their drinks here too. 

Back to the ice cream, I tried the Thai tea flavor which was really good and reasonably priced at $6. You have the option of adding additional toppings free of charge such as fresh fruit, mochi and cheesecake bites. Boba's an included topping, which I thought I would like.. but I'll pass next time. Too much chewing. 

I'm sad I didn't get to try any other flavors, but I will be back! Hopefully by then they will have some tables inside.. the stool situation was not ideal.

Edit: Got a message regarding my review, furniture is on the way! Got sent back because it wasn't the color ordered #aesthetics
author: Laverne N.

description:
I really, really wanted to love it. The store is adorable and clean, and the ice cream rolls are so freaking cute and Instagram worthy. Watching them make the ice cream rolls was fun and many people were snap chatting away. Prices are a little steep(ha) but fairly standard for SOMA.

But man, that ice cream is so bland. We got the matcha and it tasted like creamy ice with a teeny amount of matcha flavor. I'm not a fan of super sweet desserts but it felt like I was eating diet ice cream. Also since they roll it out, it was very dense and almost impossible to eat with a spoon. Toppings and mochi were generous but rolls were so overrated. Pistachio was better but still meh. 

I'll stick with their boba teas, as those are tasty and fresh!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Sometimes le boss gets on my case for being "anti-social" at work.

Pssshhhh, that's because he hasn't seen me after a couple of dranks. Just kidding, I probably wouldn't have a j.o.b. if he did and would have to go into Yelp retirement. 

I'm social....around food and people that love food. That's why Yelpers get along so well - we can talk food all day. 

STEEP has the BEST milk tea in San Francisco, even better than Boba Guys (I'm really bad at posting reviews for boba places but they're 5 stars).  When I saw Tao Tao W. check into "STEEP Creamery & Tea" and saw that they were serving Thai Ice Cream Rolls, I quickly sent the business link to Kathleen U. We kept running into each other at new business openings and she didn't make me feel crazy for taking an uber/lyft during lunch just to try a new place...because she did it too. So why not be crazy food obsessed together. 

Opening last week, STEEP Creamery is an offshoot of STEEP (in the little alleyway of Ritch) that sells made to order, handcrafted Thai Ice Cream Rolls. They're the first SF shop to offer this latest food trend. Since AT&T Park is nearby, I can imagine STEEP Creamery & Tea being very busy once baseball season comes into full swing. 

On the day we went, they had 5 flavors: My Thai (Thai Tea), Cookie Crush, Roasted Oolong, Uji Matcha, and Pistachio. They only have one size for $6. Each flavor comes with pre-set toppings but you can add any others for free: boba, housemade coconut pudding, housemade grass jelly, fresh strawberries, red bean, mochi, cookies, cheesecake bites, dark chocolate shavings, and whip cream.

They also sell their signature STEEP teas, milk teas, and UJI matcha. Caffeine free options available. They have a rewards program (buy 10, get 1 free). Cc's accepted. 

I ordered the Roasted Oolong Ice Cream Rolls which came with boba, housemade grass jelly and Kathleen ordered the My Thai (Thai Tea) that came with housemade coconut pudding, boba, and mochi: http://bit.ly/2ouDYpI

Since everything is made to order, expect a wait if there's a line (we got there early so no line). The Straus milk concoction is poured onto an iced grill, smoothed across the surface until it stiffens, and is scraped into ice rolls. 

The first time I had Thai Ice Cream Rolls was at Icicle's first location in Willow Glen (http://bit.ly/2ow3Mlh) which I enjoyed but I like STEEP's much better...

I loved the Roasted Oolong Ice Cream Roll - it was deliciously creamy and silky smooth with the perfect amount of creamy sweetness. It was literally like their Roasted Oolong Milk Tea but in ice cream sheet form. Unlike many milk tea places, the tea flavor really comes through. The boba had a good bouncy chew and the grass jelly's mildy bitter flavor balances out the sweetness. Although I liked the toppings, I'm an ice cream purist. I would have enjoyed it just as much if the rolls were nekkid because of the high quality ingredients. 

The ice cream rolls are very IG friendly and they even have a photo cube with succulents for staging so you can get that perfect picture. 

There's several stools and a bench to enjoy your ice cream treat. 

In the future, I hope STEEP considers opening a spot in Mid-Market which is in dire need of a good milk tea and dessert spot. It's going to be one expensive daily addiction but you can never have enough balls in your life, or in your mouff.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
We went here on a Sunday evening and there was a pretty steady stream of customers! The menu is concise (in a good way) and they are generous with toppings. I tried the Thai tea rolled ice cream and enjoyed the flavor and texture. It seems like high quality stuff, and the price reflects that, perhaps overly so. Each ice cream costs $6, which is quite... steep (hehe excuse the pun) even for San Francisco. If you want something simpler without the gimmick, Crossroads Cafe has large ice cream portions for a good price and is walking distance. If you're willing to pay for the hype, then give Steep a try!

I didn't order bubble tea, but boba was a topping on my ice cream. It was just the right kind of texture you want in tapioca - firm, but still chewy. 

Kind of slow process, so don't go if you're in a hurry!
author: Lauren C.

description:
4.0 stars for STEEP. 

This was my first time getting rolled ice cream. It's fun to watch them make it, and it tastes like a cross between ice cream and a deconstructed milk tea (if you get the boba topping). I got the oolong tea with boba and herbal jelly along with blueberries. SO GOOD! 

It's slightly pricey at $6 but it's one of the new trendy things these days and worth trying at least once! 

Clean, simplistic decor and friendly service.
author: Brenda L.

description:
I like the concept of ice cream roll. 
It's a chill place to hangout after lunch or dinner. Bright and clean. The menu is easy to follow.

The ice cream itself is just okay.  I'm not super impressed by it. The wait is kind of long. Not sure if they can turn down the cold plate and form the ice cream faster  ... ?_?

I would come back for casual hangout. It's still a pretty nice place. =)
author: Rachael C.

description:
Rounding up to 5 stars as I'd be excited to take anyone here for a new, fun experience, quality ice cream, and reasonable prices. Obviously one whole star is earned by the form factor.

It's hard to find - we were looking for it and walked right passed it. Look across the street for the red Alno sign as your guide; it's the door after Splunk. 

They have certainly capitalized on the trend of instagrammable food, so much so that there's actually a small photobooth with lighting and a phone tripod to get that perfect shot. Don't forget to capture that video of them freezing and rolling up the ice cream. There's a lot of time and effort that goes into this (much more than just scooping ice cream), so I can imagine how it might be a bit slow at popular times. For us, it was relatively empty near closing time and we were happy to take our time and watch the magic in the making.

Gimmicks aside, my thai iced tea ice cream was really great. I also tasted the oolong, which was good but too subtle for me. The actual amount of ice cream is pretty small, but there are plenty of toppings to make up for it (you can also get any extras you want to cram in there for free). I was a little saddened to realize that eating the rolls destroys their beauty and uniqueness, unless maybe you can withstand the cold to eat them like finger food super quick before they melt.

I'm already debating if the next trip will be to try the cookie crush ice cream I was eyeing, the matcha latte, or a boba drink. Could become a dangerous walk home.
author: Cristina S.

description:
I am so glad there is a good tea place in SOMA. 

The location: close to home. That's all that matters. Just kidding. It's a good location if you're walking. There is street parking but this is a mostly residential area, so parking is probably hard to find. If you're lucky, you'll find free two hour parking. Woohoo. It's pretty small inside. There's a bit of seating but it gets crowded quick, especially when people take breaks from work and head there with coworkers. 

The ice cream: rolled Thai tea ice cream with mochi and boba? Yes please. It doesn't really take long unless there's a ton of people. The ice cream was so good. It tasted exactly like it should...Thai tea with mochi and boba. That's all I've tried so far because I'm not a huge ice cream fan (aka I'm lactose intolerant). I can't wait to come back to try more. 

The tea: Thai tea: very delicious. It was a bit bitter but that's the way I like my tea. The regular jasmine milk tea was good too. It was a bit sweet but I just have to ask for less sugar next time. The crystal boba wasn't as sweet as other places. I couldn't really tell if I liked it or not. The regular boba was delicious. It was chewy and the perfect texture for me. 

Overall, I thought this place was really good. Luckily, it's convenient for me to get to, so I'll definitely be back to try more.
author: Cicily C.

description: I love boba tea and I've never had rolled ice cream before so we decided to order it. Now I know how the rolled ice cream is made and it tastes great! I came for food and left with new knowledge. :)
author: Eugene Z.

description:
The ice cream roll craze has finally arrived in SF! I bet they will start popping up everywhere in the city now since ice cream rolls seem to be the new poke bowls. 

I had my eye on STEEP as soon as they opened and was finally able to make the trek to SOMA after work last week. Parking was a breeze at 6pm on a weekday and there was no line to order. I'm sure that has changed now since the word is spreading. There are only three ice cream machines and the liquid mix takes a few minutes to freeze before they can get rolling (pun intended!), so depending on how backed up they are, you might be waiting for a while. 

We ordered the Mythai (thai iced tea) and the oolong flavors. They both came with a set list of toppings but you can replace or add whatever you like for no additional charge. My thai iced tea ice cream came with boba that was perfectly chewy and a coconut pudding that I enjoyed despite not being a huge fan of coconut. We both opted to add mochi because why not?

STEEP is reasonably priced and delicious, but not really that special after trying it once and getting the picture for social media (let's be honest...that's really all that matters, right?). I probably wouldn't come all the way across town to get it again, but it's a good sweet treat if you're nearby on a warm and sunny day.
author: Olivia V.

description:
Let me start off by saying this place is not expensive compared to others, the average price for rolled ice cream is $7 here and drinks are about $5. Place was quaint and hipster with seatings. I ordered a Matcha Politan with condensed milk and mochi. Ice cream was really good, not that sweet at all just perfect. The mochi was chewy and delicous. The matcha boba was also really good!
If your looking for a quick desert or drink stop by here!
author: Jason X.

description:
Welcome to the neighborhood, STEEP! I love the concept. Asian-fusion ice cream, Ujimatcha drinks, Thai tea, tapioca pearls! All in one place!

The space is tiny and immaculate. They really capitalize off of the Instagram revolution by having a little light box in the corner for you to take your food photos in perfect light -- complete with cute succulents! 

I loved that you could choose the sweetness level of drinks. The mango drink is completely vegan, no dairy. I liked that they offered an option for us lactose intolerants :)

The one thing to be aware of is that the wait can be quite long, especially if you order the ice cream rolls. Each ice cream roll is made to order so it can take a while for your order to be ready. 

Otherwise, yum. I can't wait to come back and try the matcha drinks.
author: Rose K.

description:
I am SO happy Steep added aloe to their toppings :D

Steep's selection of boba drinks and ice creams are really top-notch. Definitely recommend.
author: Eric L.

description:
After having Icicles in San Jose, and the original in New York City from 10Below, Steep does not even come close. It's unfortunate because I've been patiently waiting for rolled ice cream to make its way into San Francisco. 

First of all, our order only had 3 (visible) rolls of ice cream. THREE. Underneath the toppings laid 1 more roll of ice cream. At Icicles or 10Below, the workers fill up your WHOLE CUP with rolled ice cream.. at least 5-6 rolls per order. I paid $6 for loosely rolled up ice cream?! You're kidding! 

Boba as a topping is a nice touch, which is something I haven't seen at Steep's competitors but this isn't enough to keep me as a customer. 

The high reviews are very deceiving, as they must have been written by people who are amused by the concept and haven't had the original. You're getting ripped off people, lol!
author: Ingrid E.

description:
Awesome new ice cream and boba addition to South Beach! It was within walking distance from work. This review is only for the rolled ice cream, but I'm excited to come back to try the milk tea! I gave STEEP 4/5 stars because of the price  ($6 for ice cream is still $$$$ in my opinion although you do receive many toppings); however, I can also see this place getting extremely crowded once it becomes more popular because there are only three ice cream making stations and the process to "roll" does take a while. Overall I would recommend trying this place at least once!

[Rolled Ice Cream]
I tried the MyThai flavor while my friend tried the Oreo Cookie flavor. The MyThai came with a pudding, nicely firm tapioca, and beautifully rolled Thai Thea flavor ice cream rolls. I personally liked the Cookie flavor more with the cookie flavored cream and the Oreo, but both tasted great - not too sweet and a nice blend of toppings to complement the ice cream rolls. 

[Service] 
You do have to wait a bit for the ice cream, but the milk tea came out extremely fast for the other customers that ordered it. However, I can see a queue potentially forming during the summer as there isn't much seating or space in the shop.

Try this place before it gets too popular! You'll at least enjoy watching your ice cream being made right in front of you.
author: Alice Z.

description: Been to this second location of Steep many times with coworkers, family and friends. I've tried their matcha latte, milk tea with different toppings and rolled ice cream. Loved their C++ rolled ice cream - it had chocolate, waffle cone, and chocolate ice cream, mashed altogether and fun to watch it being made. Earl lavender milk tea was my goto decaf drink. Matcha latte was also very good, not over sweet with 25% sweet level. The only thing I couldn't really finish was their herb jelly topping when I tried the other day.. :( Drinks were a bit pricey similar to Boba Guys, but rolled ice cream was definitely worth trying and watching. If already feeling the ice cream deserves a photo, a mini photo booth awaits :-)
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Pretty place to chill in around soma. Great location for people from the office to get boba or ice cream. It's close to its first location.

What's cute is that they have a little photo light box section for your drinks and things!

Oh and build up those points to get free things!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I got the Matcha flavor and my sister got the Thai Tea flavor. Both were really great and tasted EXACTLY like the teas, in other words, the taste of the tea is there without being overly sweet.

Toppings were pretty generous and it was a good amount of ice cream. I will say I was left wanting more--but in a way that I felt like there wasn't enough to begin with. Either way, I didn't think $6 was too bad considering they also offer free toppings (e.g. Fruit, cheesecake bites, mochi)

Next time I really want to try the cookies and cream flavor. It seemed to be the most popular!
author: Angelina H.

description:
Yummy stuff!  Sweet, refreshing, and hits the spot on a warm SF day.

I have to come back to try so many other flavors.  They have everything from ice cream to boba drinks.

Although it's a little on the $ side, it's something new here.

I'll have to make a trip out again soon.
author: Julie C.

description:
Fresh boba and rolled ice cream tucked into a quiet area of San Francisco that's very close to the heart of SOMA. I've been here 3-4 times and every time it's been a high-quality experience. My go-to is the strawberry black tea boba, which comes with a puree of strawberries. You can adjust for sweetness level too. I've also tried the matcha red bean drink which is also fresh and authentic. 

I've tried the Coffee Meets Waffle rolled ice cream with cheesecake bits as toppings, and it was really creamy and delicious. Just watching them roll the ice cream is also therapeutic in its own way. You can tell that the employees here take great pride in their work and are fast to bring out the desserts too!
author: Victoria L.

description:
I tried their matcha roll with the free toppings of chocolate shavings, mochi, cheesecake and fresh fruit....which were very tarte and not ripe yet.

All in all...I don't like matcha ice cream and the roll was VERY frozen and the cup was small. About 5% kept coming out of the cup because it was so frozen I couldn't scoop anything properly.

The idea is pretty cool on bf, but not really great to eat. I would probably try the hot matcha if anything.....
author: Lynn C.

description:
# 16 Steep (not Steap) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 

Same establishment as the one on Ritch they now serve ice cream as well. 

They are #16 out of 30 in my rankings below which makes them good but not great. The customer service is good and they usually aren't too busy which is a plus. 



Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale.
