# 30 I Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
I had high hopes of this creamery place. But sad to say it's just alright! I ordered the matcha and oolong flavored ice cream rolls. 

I was expecting the matcha to taste fresh and not powdery.. the ice cream itself melted pretty fast and the matcha tasted so much like powder :(

On the brighter side the oolong tasted exactly like oolong tea! I would recommend this one. 

Maybe next time I'll try something different !
author: Jenny S.

description:
I wasn't quite into the hype of rolled ice cream. However, one wonderful rare warm weather Sunday, my friends and I came here and it was delightful! 

The flavors are truly fresh and taste natural. And free unlimited toppings whassssup. 

They do have a non-dairy coconut option off the menu! #vegan

The service was a little slow since I understand the process is more than just scooping. 

They are $6 which is actually not bad since it comes with all the toppings and is non artificial.
author: Aria S.

description:
This place should just stick to the ice cream rolls and get rid of the boba. There's so many good boba places in the city, and unfortunately this ain't one of them. But I'm absolutely addicted to the ice cream rolls here. 

Came here a few times after work. It's located in the heart of SoMa, a bit small but have a very simple yet contemporary ambiance to it. There's only 3 tables, so seating is extremely limited. STEEP is known for its ice cream rolls, they have a variety of different flavors and toppings you can try. You order at the register and then you get to watch them make it. I've only tried two of their flavors here - the black sesame one and the matcha one. Boy oh boy, they're both delicious. Oh did I mention you get FREE UNLIMITED TOPPINGS? ya, go nuts.
author: Xin W.

description: This place is pretty amazing but don't come if you're in a rush.  Your order will take some time since they literally have to make your ice cream.  It's a very fun process to watch and the unlimited toppings is pretty awesome.  The Thai iced cream was delicious.  I added mochi, fruit and boba.  One serving is enough to split.  The employees working here deserve mad props because they put a lot of work, and I'm talking there's some physical labor in there, to make each order.
author: Alana M.

description:
Atmosphere [4.5/5]: The store is clean and cute. They have around 3 high-top tables - it could get crowded so wish they could get more sitting space. 

Desserts: we ordered 4 flavors of the rolled ice cream. They were all pretty nice, and we can tell that the ingredients are good. They use Straus milk for their rolled ice cream, which makes a difference in the taste. And, FREE toppings!

 - Uji Matcha [4.5/5]: how can matcha go wrong? The flavor of matcha is pure, strong and at right amount. The only thing was that this one melted very fast for some reason so I took off half point.

 - Original Oolong [5/5]: our favorite of the night! The oolong flavor is great - strong and perfect balance of the sweet from the cream and the bitter from the tea. 

 - Black Sesame [4.5/5]: we could taste the generous amount of black sesame they put in. But I found it getting a bit sweet as I eat more. 

 - Mango Coconut [4/5]: personally, I am not a huge fan of this one; yet, it is quite refreshing and is certainly not the artificial flavor of mango. 

Will go back when craving for rolled ice cream!
author: Susan C.

description:
Stopped by after lunch to try out their roll ice cream and was pleasantly surprised! 
I've been to several roll ice cream shops and I can say STEEP is one of the few that produces strong and authentic flavors. 

DESSERT: 
Steep serves ice cream and drinks. Their roll ice cream is one of their newer items on the menu. I love all their roll ice cream flavors they offer, especially their tea flavors. They also offer toppings such as: cheesecake, mochi, fruits and cookie crumbs which are all included in the cost of the roll ice cream. 
We ordered: 
+ Roasted Oolong Milk Tea $4: I actually found their drink to be strong in their tea flavor, but my BF did not like the graininess of the tea, but I didn't mind it.
+ Roasted Pistachio w/ boba and matcha pudding $5: I was a little hesitant to order this because most places use artificial pistachio flavors, masked in sugar and chunks of pistachio. BUT not STEEP. You can taste that they blended pure roasted pistachio into their base and it tasted delicious! The matcha pudding, cheesecake and mochi were a good touch, but I did not like it with boba. 
+ Uji matcha w/ mochi and fruits $5: wow. I was very impressed by the strong matcha flavor. It was more on the bitter side which is how I like my matcha. It means their they didn't skim on the matcha powder! 

Compared to most other roll ice cream shops, they serve less quantity of rolls than most places. 

SERVICE: 
The guy that took our order was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. We did not have to wait long for our order. 

AMBIANCE: 
Natural lighting, clean and simple. They only have 2 narrow tables with 4 chairs each and a bench near the front. So seating is limited. 

Verdict: I would totally be back to try their other flavors.
author: Samantha F.

description:
Oreo milkshake was alright. Didn't see it on the menu but the hostess told us about the milkshakes. This location is pretty isolated from other shops. I can imagine parking can be bad during the day but I came at 6:45pm on a Sunday so I parked across the street without any difficulty. 

They have a platform for people to take their food photo. What a great way for free advertisement. It's also creative (;
author: Jess W.

description: Boba & rolled ice cream? Yes STEEP got you covered! Love their concept and literally anything you get on their menu, its so SO good! I havent gotten something that disappointed me. Although there are some drinks i personally like more. Matcha sesame latte, roasted oolong milk tea and kumquat tangerine green tea. If you love sesame and matcha, you HAVE to get the matcha sesame drink or the matchapolis ice cream. They have the best matcha and it cant go wrong! Bobas always on point too!
author: Ho H.

description:
*** In Short ***

Tasty and Instagram-worthy Thai-style rolled ice cream.

*** In Depth ***

I'd been wanting to try Thai rolled ice cream ever since I first came across it on Reddit, so I was pretty excited when I found out that I could get it here in the heart of SF, rather than going all the way to Taiwan (KIDDING, kidding - Thailand), inevitable hipster tax be damned. And while it's missing the appeal of being served from atop a giant ice block from a dingy street stall, their approach with the ice cold metal surfaces is undoubtedly far more hygienic.

They have a few options that always seem to be available, as well as daily/seasonal specials. If you're a fan of chocolate ice cream and brownies, and ever see the C++ on the menu (this IS tech central, after all), I'd highly recommend giving that a go.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - While not exactly tiny, with the high top seating on the side and the rolling stations to the other, aisle space can be a premium, especially if a bunch of people are milling about, recording their ice cream being rolled.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Ice cream rolled out and up!  The place has a great selection and very friendly staff.

The made to order ice cream is excellent, I had the Key Line flavor with tiny crumbs of graham cracker crust sprinkled on - rock in'!

I recommend it for sure, cool spot.
author: James D.

description:
I was actually on my way to Steap Tea Bar.. But somehow my Maps accidentally sent me to STEEP Creamery & Tea- has that happened to anyone? LOL 

We tried their Mango Fruit Tea (4/5)- I wish I could have asked for extra sweetness because the taste was too subtle. I really like the mango pieces tho

! We also tried the Legendary Matcha Milk Tea (3/5) cause I tried waay  better matcha milk tea, I should have tried the strawberry matcha lemonade.. That would have been different (& possibly better). 

Personally, I didn't try their ice cream so I don't want to give them a bad review. If they're specializing on ice cream, you shouldn't  dislike the business on the quality of their boba- ya feel me? I'm just really critical on the quality of boba cause I've tried better ones in San Jose

Come & try this business for yourself! Ask the staff for their opinions :)
author: Jezza Mei O.

description:
Cute space, but the one in Ritch is way better! I ordered a peach milk tea here without adjusting sweetness and ice..and it was wayyy too sweet, it was pretty much undrinkable!! I never adjust the sweetness on drinks I order from Steep on Ritch St, so that way very surprising. 

On the plus side, they do have ice cream curls here which seems to be the more popular treat here.

If you order boba, just know that they run sweeter than most and to definitely adjust your sweetness level!! A-ok for a quick boba fix..
author: Jennifer S.

description: YES quality boba and great location. There's no other quality boba in this area--ok except for their other Steep location in Ritch Alley. This location has their rolled ice cream though. Clever ice cream names and combos. I'm a fan
author: Alias A.

description: Stopped by this place after a Giants game. Ice cream tastes good. It's just getting used to ice cream texture in a roll form. Toppings are free. Strawberry and matcha ice cream are really delicious. The coffee ice cream didn't have enough flavor. The shop has a small inside sitting area but I think that's normal for SF. Overall, STEEP is good place to go if your group wants ice cream and Boba.
author: Geraldine N.

description: Yum!!! Creamy and silly smooth texture rolled ice cream with great toppings like fruit, cheesecake, mochi, chocolate flakes, etc. Will definitely come back and try other flavors.
author: Vinitha R.

description: Ah STEEP. Welcome to my hood.  It's taken a REALLY long time for businesses to open in this part of SOMA, so when I saw STEEP's sign as they were constructing their spot, I was super excited.  The whole "rolled" ice cream thing took over the Internet and there wasn't any place for me to try it nearby.  Enter STEEP. Getting your rolled ice cream fix is now more accessible than ever.  My only rub? It's just OK in taste.  I still prefer my precious soft serve options and it's hard to deny the superior tastes of Humphrey Slocombe at the Ferry Building as well.  That being said, I did enjoy the Oreo mix concoction and watching them make it was mesmerizing too. I love that this is here now, here's to hoping that more shops like STEEP come soon!
author: Lisa I.

description:
Soooo good. They have unique combinations of ice cream and the toppings they put on afterwards really make all the flavors pop. The ice cream tastes fresh and isn't too sweet despite everything that comes included with it. We also got a drink here - the milk tea is perfectly creamy without being too sweet and the boba balls were nice and juicy (not like with some other places where they are semi frozen, yuck).

The staff was super friendly and knew what they were doing, and it was really cool to watch them make the ice cream. And they even have a "photobooth" where you can take a picture of your dessert after they've made it and post it to social media. 

Great find!
author: Anita L.

description: Great tea and not a far walk from tea the Caltrain station! I came here with a friend and we ordered the rolled ice cream and two drinks. The inside of the shop is super cute and very comfy. The service was great, too. Also, the bathroom was cleaner than most places.
author: Cheryl O.

description:
I thought SF had reached peak ice cream what with HS, Smitten, Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous, Bi-Rite, etc. But it seems we're getting another wave of ice cream with an Asian twist and/or fancy presentations. I'm talking about Garden Creamery, Powder, Uji Time, and Steep.

At steep they have special tables with cooling elements on which they pour the liquid, Once frozen they scrape it up into a mound then carefully smooth it out into a thin square. Then they scrape it up row by row into nice little rolls and topped with yummy treats like boba, coconut jelly, mochi, etc.

As you may have guessed this is a very labor intensive process. So don't expect your ice cream to be ready quickly. I'm guessing 10 min at least? But it's very entertaining to watch so all is forgiven.

A few minor quibbles -

 - I wish they had a better container for the ice cream rolls and toppings. Looks cute but you have to be very dextrous to eat without toppings falling all over the place. Then because toppings are on top when you're halfway through you're just left with ice cream with no toppings which makes me sad.

 - this is literally frozen water so it's not creamy or fluffy since it's not churned like ice cream. The rolls are actually very dense and I'm not sure I like how hard they are texture wise. You have to work harder with the spoon to even get a scoop and it just sits kinda cold in your mouth.

Even on weekends this place is not too busy.
author: Jean K.

description: Ambiance and the prices are right but the flavor is a miss. I ordered the cookie crush and it was very bland. My best friend ordered the shortcake strawberry which had a little bit of flavor. They are a little skimpy with the mix-Ins which may be why the ice cream is bland. Won't be coming back.
author: Danielle S.

description: Really unique and delicious. Made to order, thinly rolled sheets of ice cream, you'll enjoy watching them make it almost as much as you'll enjoy eating. Really delicious ice teas with boba as well.
author: Donna B.

description:
Sorely disappointed with this place. 

I know these guys are known for their ice cream rolls so the staff mainly focused on getting those out to the customers while only one person cashiered and made the drink orders. Our three drinks took over thirty minutes to get to us only after I reminded them that we had yet to receive them. 

I ordered a roasted oolong with boba and it was no bueno. Watered down and had ice filled to the top even though I asked for light ice. Would not recommend.
author: Natalie Y.

description: I have been to both their permanent location and their pop up and while the permanent location does a decent ice cream, their pop up was less than desirable. I had ordered their basic matcha with boba and 100% sweetness (it was a long day and I just succeeded in completing a major project and needed a quick pick me up before getting back to my desk quickly) and when I picked up my drink, I saw that the boba was missing so I asked if they could add it. It took a few minutes for them to add it and by then I was running late. I grabbed a straw and started to head out, taking a sip at the door to find that it was not sweetened at all (I drink matcha on a very regular basis so while I was expecting a sweet drink the straight matcha was not horrible, just not what I needed this afternoon) and when I went back and asked about it, I had two different responses on the sweetness so I figured I could not trust having it remade (and I was late already.) I would suggest getting their ice cream as it is fun to watch them make it, but maybe skip their boba teas unless you want to go back multiple times to get it right.
author: Beth I.

description: I had a taste of the cookies & cream and the black sesame rolled ice cream, but oolong was THE ONE! It pairs so nicely with the toppings of herbal jelly and boba. Definitely will be back for the oolong!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
What do you do when you have a sweet craving and there's nothing nearby that interest you? Ask Yelp!So Yelp brought me to STEEP and it's nearby enough to get to from fidi so I gave it a try.  

Never tried rolled ice cream before so for my first time, I think it's pretty darn good.  I had the original oolong ice cream with boba and grass jelly.  It's creamy and not overly sweet.  It tasted just like a boba milk tea in ice cream form.  One thing I regretted is not reading few more reviews ahead of time because I wanted the mochi toppings but it didn't come with my order.  Didn't know you can ask for it until I read the reviews at home.  Bummer!

Also why not 5 stars because my portion came out some what smaller than the cheesecake ice cream when comparing side by side.  I was hoping for a instagrammy shot (the shop has a little photo booth set up) but my cup seems a little sad looking.

Price is reasonable for what you get and a good place to go for some Asian style creamery as there's really nothing around the downtown area.  Will go back and try their boba tea and other ice cream flavors.
author: Shirley H.

description: This is only second time having rolled ice cream so I'm no connoisseur but it was disappointing. I had the Uji Matcha - the consistency was too thick and the flavor was not good.  Not sure if it was because there was a rush and the maker went from order to order. Minimal toppings also make it disappointing. Probably won't be back.
author: Leona W.

description:
A welcome addition to quiet South Beach street scene. They've expanded their hours since their first months, so that's awesome.

The ice cream rolls with boba is a great twist on Asian snacks. Oh and the matcha menu is legit too, one should not require sugar to enjoy tea.
author: Anthony W.

description: What a cute little ice cream and tea store! San Francisco needs more rolled ice cream options, and STEEP certainly fills the gap! I stopped by here for dessert and got the matcha rolled ice cream, which came with strawberries and lots of red bean. The ice cream here certainly isn't cheap at $6 a cup, and only about half of it is filled with ice cream (the other half is made of toppings). But while the value isn't fantastic, the ingredients are definitely of high quality, and the atmosphere is nice and trendy as well.
author: David K.

description:
Boyfriend and I shared the oolong tea ice cream rolls. We asked for some extra toppings with our order and they gave it to us for free of charge :) it was $6 total. The rolls were much thicker in texture than other places I've tried. 

Parking was a piece of cake in this area. Strange location since there aren't too many stores nearby. 

Store is super clean and well lit. I really like their photo booth idea. Easy way to market their business!
author: Sarah T.

description: It was fresh tasting and delicious. I ordered the coffee meets waffle which tasted jut like cold brew coffee! The topping was waffle cone but I think you can ask to to add any because I did for free. They roll it really cold therefore it doesn't melt fast!! There is a small but all very tasty selection. Can't go wrong
author: Rubi D.

description:
This place is AMAZING for their rolled ice cream. The matcha tasted incredibly rich and the texture was very smooth. In addition, you can add unlimited toppings - I added fruits, mochi, and condensed milk! The staff here is also very friendly and hard-working. When they were making my friend's ice cream rolls, one of them cracked and wasn't holding very well, and they re-made it without a question. 

They also have a cute photo station assembled where you can take a picture of your ice cream with some succulents in the background. Definitely a must for all of you hipsters out there~

The only con of this place is the lack of seating because it's so small. Definitely consider this if you have a large party. However, this will definitely not deter me from returning again!
author: Sheila S.

description:
I'm glad that there's finally an ice cream roll and boba shop nearby me now! I've came here twice and tried the matcha and strawberry ice cream rolls. Both of them had a strong tasty and creamy flavor. It wasn't too sweet either. I suggest adding boba, mochi, and fresh strawberries, they go really well together! 

Store is clean, customer service was nice and friendly, and right next to at&t ball park. Emily helped me out and suggested the strawberry cheese cake rolls, definitely will try again!
author: Chris M.

description:
Black sesame with agar boba, fruit, and mochi! Probably wouldn't get the black sesame flavor again because it has a weird after taste, but everything else on the menu looked good including their green teas! $6

Side note: the ice cream tastes better when you let it sit for a few min because right when they give it to you it's too icy and kinda chalky
author: Mallory B.

description: STEEP was my first experience having rolled ice cream. I loved watching it be made into rolls. The staff was friendly and the ice cream was super tasty. Perfect on a warm SF day.
author: Katie K.

description:
YIPPEE STEEPEE!! you have done it again!!

I love STEEP so much that I am planning to try all flavors they have (not to mention they have weekly special or something, it's a never-ending tasting contest for me!)

So far I have tried Chocolate, Ooolong tea, Pistachio, and Matcha:

Chocolate - is good if you adore the rich texture and aftertaste of chocolate
Oolong tea - what can I say? It sure tastes like tea!!! 
Pistachio - Pistachio is HEAVEN. There is real pistachio inside mmmhhmmmm I want it now..
Matcha - I am not a matcha person, but this does taste like legit matcha! and it's good with the fresh, organic strawberries...

TIPS FOR YA: Boba as topping is cool, however, if you leave the boba with the ice cream for too long, boba would become rock hard. I don't know bout you but I am #TeamSoftBoba. Just sayinggg
author: Ella U.

description: Came here on a hot day and walked 25 mins in uncomfortable shoes just get here. Was totally worth it - the Thai tea rolls tasted just like Thai iced tea. I also got a strawberry tea which was good but nothing to rave about. Definitely will be back to try the other ice cream roll flavors!
author: Dani T.

description: Suprisingly cheap in cost but high quality ice cream. Pretty cool experience, took the lady here on a day out in the city and she enjoyed it. We got the Matcha rolled ice cream (could do w/o the red beans) with mochi, cheesecake and fruits. Overall pretty good but theres a place called lets roll in Sunset that does rolled Ice Cream. Its a little more costly but I think they have more of a bang for your buck.
author: Navdeep D.

description: Love their menu items. My peach oolong tea tastes pretty good but boba is too over cooked. Prefer the chewier ones.
author: Cloudy F.

description:
Rolled ice cream is a sensational Thai frozen dessert. And no, you don't need an international plane ticket to get your hands on a cup of rolled ice cream. 

Today, I indulged myself in a cup of freshly made to order Ujimatcha topped with strawberry and red bean. The experience? Simply authentic! The Ujimatcha rolled ice cream was rich in flavor, creamy and yielded a refreshing bittersweet silky taste. This place will keep me coming back for more! 

It's definitely worth the visit to STEEP creamery!
author: Amy Karina C.

description:
YES! Finally tried the famous rolled ice cream :D

Maybe it's a little hyped up but sometimes, you just wanna know! This place is super close to my work so I wrangled up some friends to go with me. I wanted to have their Black Sesame flavor but unfortunately when I went they were sold out :( So I settled with Thai Tea plus Fruit and Matcha Pudding. They don't us many ingredients and it's a very small portion of ice cream but it was refreshing and super delightful to eat on a unusually HOT SF day. The quality of the ingredients is pretty good and you learn a lot about their ingredient sourcing but there isn't much too it. In the end, it's a pretty pricey ice cream, coming in at $6 dollars for, what would add up to being 1 scoop plus toppings. 

I'd like to go again and try the Black Sesame and maybe I'll take a bubble tea too at some point! Great to check out if you've never experienced the ice cream roll but probably not an ongoing place to go time after time unless you have $$$$ hah
author: Nerissa C.

description:
I fell in love with STEEP and couldn't wait for STEEP Creamery to open. Came in today at 2pm for their soft opening with some friends and we were super excited with their newly feature Thai rolled ice cream. 

They use organic Straus Milk infused with loose leaf teas. They offer Thai, Roasted Oolong, Ceremonial Uji Matcha, and Cookie Crush. I didn't want extra caffeine since I ordered for a white cocoa matcha latte so I went with the cookie crush. It was AMAZING! Not too sweet and super creamy. They make their own whipping cream which is definitely a plus! $6 worth spent! 

Along with ice creams, they also offer a variety of bubble tea drinks. From earl grey lavender, uji matcha, mango mousse, to tai guan yin tea. Lots of selections! I'm excited just writing this..! 

Great customer service and will definitely be back!
author: Lily X.

description:
This milk tea here is disgusting. I ordered the Legendary Match Milk Tea and added red beans. The tea tasted like water with a scoop of matcha. The red beans are what added the sweetness and made it taste remotely decent.

My boyfriend ordered the Mango Fruit Tea with coconut pudding. This just tasted like water with a splash of mango flavor. The coconut pudding had the texture of firm tofu. 

The service was good, the employees were very nice and friendly. But the drinks were just really hard to swallow. Do they not taste the drinks here that they are serving?
author: Brittany N.

description:
Yes this is my second review and yes this is my second time there in a week and i'm going again tomorrow. WHY? BECAUSE ITS DELICIOUS. But really, co-workers came into town and had to take them because they don't know what rolled ice cream is. It was an educational trip. Because there was a big group of 7 of us, we took the opportunity to order all 4 flavors to try. I took a little nibble of eat. 

1. Matcha - so you can get this with the ice cream ROLLED into the ice cream or on the side or both. We got it on the side. It was so good, not overly sweet and not overly matcha powdery flavored either. The strawberry and red bean is a great compliment. 
2. MyThai - STEEP has some of the best Thai Tea in town and this in rolled flavor is exactly the same. creamy, again not overly sweet. it comes with coconut pudding and boba. This is was my time having their coconut pudding despite going to their original location forever. I will now be occasionally adding coconut pudding to my drinks. I'm not a fan of coconut but this was not over powering at all. 
3. Cookies and Cream - a favorite of 2 of my co-workers who finished it all. It's pretty much how you would expect it to taste and was just equally as good. 
4. Roasted Oolong - see original review

Also I'm a fan of their jasmine green milk tea too. Even unsweet, its just enough and you can def taste how fresh the tea is. One point though is that I do wish the coconut and match pudding are a bit more of a pudding consistency versus a harder jello type form. However this isn't enough to dock any stars.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Went here with a coworker to grab some boba.  It was sweet and sugary, just the way I like it :)  I didn't get a chance to try the ice cream, but they seemed to have a good selection and I would really like try the rest of their selection of treats.  I'll be back soon if I need another quick boba treat during work.
author: Jordan S.

description:
The first time I had ice cream rolls was in SoCal at Chelo, thought it was meh.

STEEP changed my mind. This place is quite close to my work so we stopped by during lunch for some dessert. We shared a matcha ice cream roll. It came with red bean and strawberry toppings. The matcha is BEST, not overly sweet and just the right amount of matcha flavor.

Definitely recommend this if you're a matcha fan.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Tea is good quality. For some reason, my Matcha yea didn't taste well :( but other things like Classic Thai and cookie dough ice cream tasted great
author: Pranam D.

description:
Service is great. The food flavors are just ok. I've tried matcha, Oreo,Thai tea and oolong tea. I gotta say the matcha was my least favorite even though I'm a big matcha fan. The matcha flavor is lacking. The Thai tea is not bad. My favorite is the oolong tea. Love how they give you unlimited toppings. I like their matcha pudding!

I opted out of the red beans since they are too filling. Don't be afraid to change out the toppings from the suggested toppings.

I love their mini photo shoot area. Very creative!
author: Ivy L.

description: I've been eyeing this place the last couple times I was headed to a Giant's game and finally decided to try it. I got the "Cookie Crush" which is a cup of rolled cookies and cream ice cream (5 rolls) with cookies and cream whipped cream topped off with an Oreo cookie.. very yummy, although the price may be a little STEEP for some.. $6, it was worth it nonetheless. They have some bar stools in the window and a couple benches for seating, but other than that there aren't any tables. On a busy day you might feel a bit cramped. Simple and modern; I'd go back.
author: Ashley A.

description:
I was surprised to see STEEP has expanded and opened another location a couple blocks away! Even better, they sell rolled up ice cream! I think the price for rolled up ice cream is a little steep (har har) especially because you get a smaller quantity. For that price I'd rather get a giant scoop of ice cream. Not to mention that rolled up ice cream is more on the icy-side to keep its consistency.

I think it's really generous of them that they offer complimentary toppings if you ask nicely.
author: Janet H.

description:
Love the cream top black tea

The ice cream rolls might be kind of a gimmick but they're fun to watch being made. My kid was enchanted.
author: Kate J.

description:
Black sesame ice that tastes like peanut butter. Rock hard ice cream that comes in a flimsy cup. But you have a cool selfie station, that's nice! 
How come there is no selfie station in your bathroom with NO toilet seat covers. NO paper towels. Overflowing trash can and really love the special touch of all your nasty cleaning supplies thrown in the corner. #notimpressed #ew
author: Jess K.

description:
Freshly prepared ice cream with tea infused flavors. They don't skimp on the toppings either. I was surprised with loads of boba and mochi in my ice cream. Only wish I can eat this everyday without getting fat.

Also they have all the same drinks as you can get at the other Steep location. So even if you don't feel like ice cream, you can still get your favorite milk tea.
author: Steve M.

description:
Finally! An ice cream and milk tea shop in SoMa. It's become one of my favorite go-to spots in the neighborhood.

Roasted Oolong Milk Tea: By far my favorite drink on the menu and top 5 favorites in the Bay.

Matcha Milk Tea: Matcha can be one of those flavors that can be subtle or weak if not properly prepared but the tea flavor comes through here.

Mango Mousse: A twist on the traditional mango sago drink. This one is made with almond milk and completely vegan.

Ice cream rolls: If you're a fan of tea flavored desserts, then definitely try the Original Oolong and MyThai. Uji Matcha was a bit bland. They also have some new flavors like Pistachio and Coffee with waffle mixed in.
author: Chris S.

description:
I heard from a couple of friends that this place was a must try, especially because they had ice cream rolls designed after hype tea flavors and instagram trends. I thought the thai tea rolls were a bit too sweet for my liking and didn't really reflect the flavors of an authentic thai tea. Even though the main attraction was somewhat of a disappointment, the other side toppings inside were great. I really enjoyed the boba and what I think are mochi pudding squares complementing the ice cream rolls. 

Basically, this place has potential. The ice cream could be better but I think I'm better off dropping some $$$ on their tea instead with a good selection of add-ons. The STEEP price for ice cream rolls in my opinion is just not worth it.
author: Felix L.

description:
They just opened, but I strongly urge you to try! Sometimes their specialty menu surprises me, as a huge bubble tea fan, I got earl grey milk tea rolls today.
One thing I really appreciate is that you got free toppings, definitely try out the cheese cake!
author: Para S.

description:
Mythai is the best although pistachio and ujimatcha have great STRONG flavors. It was good with yummy toppings although it tasted pretty much like regular ice cream to me. But it was a cool experience and I will try the drinks next :)

The downside is that it takes awhile to make each individual cup of ice cream.
author: Karen J.

description:
I don't understand why everyones complaining about their prices?! For $6 you get a full cup of  delicious-ness, packed with organic Straus ice cream and unlimited toppings! If you're comparing STEEP to other rolled ice cream places, WHY? You just can't! They dont use flavored syrup or powder to make any of their drinks and ice cream base. Although portion is smaller than others but they definitely don't charge you $8-$9..! Also they don't skimp out on the toppings when you ask for more too. But realistically this is enough sweets for one person. Honestly, if you go to any other ice cream parlor, they easily charge you $4-$5 for a single scoop. You're getting a deal here! 

They have 4 regular flavors - uji matcha, organic oolong, mythai, and cookie crush. They alter flavors weekly, today they had C+++ (biegium chocolate), black and orange (orange cream). I ordered for a uji matcha roll that paired very well with fresh strawberries and red bean. The ice cream wasn't overly sweet but the red bean gave it a kick to the sweetness, which was perfext! I also ordered for a mango mousse with bubble. Made with coconut milk so completely vegan for the ones that can't drink dairy. It was so creamy and had a great balance of mango and coconut, bubble was on point sweet and good consistency. I could drink one everyday! 

I'm so addicted to you Steep!! Can you please open more shops!
author: Stella L.

description:
$6 is what I paid for my frozen concoction. This price is considered a bit high but you're paying $6 for the novelty of the ice cream rolls and you're paying for quality ingredients. I saw that they use Straus (milk? cream?) in the ice cream base. They make their ice cream bases fresh. I've been here a few times to see if there are any different flavors. I've seen pictures of various flavors and it seems that the flavors will be rotating. I've tried the thai, oolong milk tea and the matcha ice cream rolls. I like that you can add additional toppings (for FREE) and can make some substitutions/changes to your order. 

My favorite one so far has to be the oolong milk tea. You can definitely taste the tea flavor and it is heavenly! (What do you expect when the shop sells tea as well?!) I would totally pick up this flavor if it somehow made its way to the frozen aisle at the supermarket -- it's that delicious! 

For the matcha flavor, you are able to have the strawberries mixed in. I find that it tastes better with the strawberries not mixed in with the matcha. I love that this one comes with red bean. I was able to add mochi to it and it was so yummy! 

One of my few gripes with Steep is how crowded it gets in the afternoon. WHY MUST EVERYONE COME OUT FOR A BREAK AT SAME TIME AS EVERYONE ELSE? However, I shouldn't be too surprised by this, considering the location of this shop. We were lucky the few times we visited because parking wasn't too difficult. 

OH and there's an adorable photo booth with succulents!
author: Jay Z.

description:
I've been here several times now, every time I'm pretty much back here for their matcha latte. I have searched far & wide for a tea spot that can make one that rivals Intelligentsia's in Silverlake District in Los Angeles. 

My boyfriend also is a fan of their rolled ice cream. We've been to Chello in SoCal & Icicles in San Jose and we both definitely agree that we like the rolls at STEEP the best, by far.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Delicious new take on ice cream!  The pictures will show you everything you need to know :)  Plus they have the usual selection of bubble milk tea.  Really friendly staff.

Limited seating inside.  Come on a nice day and bring your ice cream or drinks a block away to nearby South Park (in the block surrounded by Bryant, Brannan, 2nd, and 3rd).
author: Greg B.

description: Favorite rolled ice cream I've been to! They're also open pretty late, which is cool for a late treat. I really enjoyed the My Thai and the Matcha Green tea! Highly recommend coming here for rolled ice cream & a good place to hang out :)
author: Lexy G.

description: I don't give out 5 star reviews but this one is worth giving. I rode Uber all the way here so I'm pretty excited. I bought the Thai Tea ice cream roll with boba and mochi. It was really good. The boba was so soft. It felt like a party in my mouth. The mochi was really good and soft. The ice cream was really good and cold. It tastes like actual Thai Tea. Overall, I will definitely be back! It was worth the Uber ride!
author: Jonathan Z.

description: All the flavors are good and tested by the owner before putting it on the menu. Fast service but no parking during baseball games. All ingredients are fresh and its not too sweet. Must try all the flavors!
author: Jan H.

description: Something different... kids enjoyed seeing their ice cream made. Liked that you can add toppings for free. Ice cream flavors are good but they need to add more (flavors)
author: Angel L.

description:
Great boba and rolled ice cream shop, conveniently located in SoMa.  

I haven't tried their rolled ice cream, but their boba's pretty good.  Their tea tastes refreshing and they have a nice rotating selection of flavors (a couple rotating for the season, the rest stay constant I think).  
The store's well lit and has a nice area to lounge and look out at the street.  It's also very conveniently located for any other tech workers around AT&T park.  Bonus, they've got a light box, so you can take your fancy instagram photos with some props and nice lighting :P
author: Keith C.

description:
Thai styled rolled ice creams? Yes please!

Tried the oolong and matcha and they were both delicious! They were about about $6 each and they offer some additional free toppings like mochi or cheesecake bits (it changes)!

I also wanted to try the pistachio but when I went there they did not have it anymore (they changed it to cereal). Hope it'll come back!
author: Janet K.

description: We tried the strawberry cheesecake and cookies and cream. Ordered for take out and walked it home about 3 blocks. It survived the walk and stayed fresh the next day in the freezer. Not too sweet and fluffy texture! Will be back soon.
author: Maria C.

description:
Went with a few friends, and everyone was pleasantly surprised. Maybe hand rolling ice cream is actually a functional trend. 

Tried all the base flavors and they were all really good, so comes down to your personal preference. Obvious favorites are thai tea and matcha flavors, but if you have a thing for pistachios, then i'd say definitely try it.

I don't have the most effective palettes, but the difference between rolled ice cream here and regular ice cream is obvious. Flavors are more intense and the texture is much creamier. 

Bottom line is glad i tried, and would go back.
author: Davin C.

description:
Boba in this place is insane. Pretty silky and smooth. I always get the plain black with 25% because I can't handle too much sweet. 

The service is amazing. I placed a wrong order last week and the owner switched for me at no cost.

They also have a loyalty program where you get 1 free after 10 purchases!

Highly recommended
author: Daniel C.

description:
Finally got around to trying to place before a ball game. It wasn't packed when I visited but i heard there's normally a line. I can see why. Their ice cream is good and flavorful. I got the Original Oolong, which has Oolong Tea ice crea, with boba and herbal jelly. Yes, super asian, but I'm a sucker for ice creams with tea flavors, mainly because it's really hard to find a place that actually makes it well. Steep makes this very well; you can actually taste the tea in the ice cream. 

The only thing to be aware of is that the ice cream is really dense, so it feels heavier than normal. I shared with someone and it was the perfect amount.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
The coffee meets waffle icecream is SO good and you can add as many of the toppings for free as you'd like (mochi, fruit--though I wouldn't recommend it for this one), cheesecake bites, etc). The oolong icecream was good but compared to the coffee, the flavor was REALLY light...almost to where you couldn't really taste the flavor.

There wasn't really a line when I came which made it great but even without a line, the icecream DOES take a while to make. If there were a long line of people, then I would understand why people get annoyed on why it takes so long just to get something like icecream.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Earl grey lavender is caffeine free and SUPER delicious!! :)
Rolled ice cream is also absolutely stunning; the consistency is pretty thick though
author: Frances W.

description:
It's really fun to watch the ice cream being made! Fun spot to take friends, and the flavors are really yummy (we've tried the Thai Ice Cream and the Cookies n Cream). Between those two, the Cookies n Cream was really delicious! 

The ambience is really nice and fresh, and usually the wait isn't too long. They have benches outside which my friend and I sat on. It was great because we saw so many cute dogs pass by.
author: Priya B.

description: Only stopped here for some tea on a hot day.  The place was a little difficult to find.  Also be sure to check their hours as the 2 locations have different hours and aren't really that far apart from one another.  Just make sure you're going to the right one!  Anyways, this location is really nice, a small amount of seating available.  The place was pretty busy, but most customers were just waiting for rolled up ice cream.  Decided to just get some tea since I didn't see any pitaya or acai at this location.  The mango tea was refreshing.  The mango puree tasted very fresh, it was on the sweet side.  However, it didn't really mix that well with the tea, overall still a satisfying drink.  I'll have to come back again for the ice cream, just keep in mind that there might be a wait for it depending on how busy it is just because it takes so long to be made.
author: Bryson L.

description: I got matcha roll ice cream that was great. Also, on top with moji, red bean strawberry and chocolate.
author: Pinarat S.

description: Yummyyyy! Loved their ice cream  I feel like trying all the flavors! And next time will try the tea.. a good thing about the place is they open till late hours as well.
author: Alia K.

description: This whole place was very aesthetic!! I came here at 3pm and there was no line. I ordered the my Thai since everyone claims it to be very good and the Jasmine milk tea with boba. They made my ice cream right away but the cup size was very small and I noticed there was only 5 rolls in the cup. Considering that I paid 7$ for rolled ice cream I thought I could pick out my own toppings. The ice cream rolls came with coconut pudding and boba. After I finished my ice cream I threw the rest away. Wasn't impressive at all. I would just go back to icicles again LOL. However my brother loved his Jasmine milk tea with boba.
author: Tina C.

description:
I've been to the other STEEP location before and enjoyed their teas, so I thought I'd check out the Creamery location during my spare time! This location also does teas, but I think the main appeal is their rolled ice cream. It was my first time getting rolled ice cream so I was looking forward to it.

I got the strawberry cheesecake flavor, which has cheesecake incorporated into the ice cream and is topped with cheesecake bits and strawberries. The serving is very reasonable and they give you a lot of toppings! My friends got a cookies and cream flavor, and we all agreed that the strawberry cheesecake was better. The ice cream was pretty creamy and thick, but I'm pretty sure that was because of the cheesecake in the ice cream and not necessarily because of the actual ice cream.

I also got the earl grey lavender milk tea (50% sweetness) for later to have and I have to say, the flavors were a bit too strong for my liking. There was too much going on. I'd pass on this one.

Overall, I liked it and I'd come back again if I was in the area, but it's not something I'd crave and/or go out of my way for. For now, I think I'll continue to go to the original STEEP location since I think they do teas better.
author: Trisha V.

description: I was excited to see that there was one of these ice cream roll places right in SF so we could try out the new trend-- the fact that it was tea-themed was just even better! The employees were incredibly kind and friendly. When we visited, there were twins who were rolling our ice creams side by side at the same time which was so fun to watch! They gave us a little extra ice cream in a cup that didn't quite make it into perfect roll formation. It was a lot of ice cream! And they were generous on the toppings. Definitely a fun place to check out near AT&T park. Also, I love when boba places let you select how sweet you want your milk tea to be- 25% is just perfect!
author: Suzi P.

description: Iced drinsk only come in 24oz/ $4. Pretty good value compared to boba guys. The boba is not as soft as boba guys i will admit but I enjoyed the coffee base in this one more. I like that they didnt overload my drink with ice
author: Song K.

description:
First try, pretty yummy. Had Earl grey lavender tea with boba, Jasmine tea with jelly, coconut ice cream (extra fruit), strawberry shortcake (extra fruit) + uptown (mochi + almond flakes). All were delicious. No disappointments. Love the FREE toppings option.
Only thing I would say is to have some lower tables/chairs to make it more kid-friendly (safety).
Will definitely be back!
author: s t.

description:
They have ice cream rolls here! All the rage. 

High quality boba too. Really cute interior.

All good portion sizes.
author: Charles C.

description:
Ice cream rolls in SF?? Count me in! :)

When I had my first ice cream rolls at Chelo Creamery in SoCal, it was a huge disappointment. Chelo's ice cream rolls fell apart and the flavors were just not there. But after having the ice cream rolls at STEEP, everything was perfect. We had the MYTHAI & UJIMATCHA ice cream rolls. The MYTHAI had thai tea ice cream topped with boba and coconut pudding. The UJIMATCHA had matcha ice cream topped with fresh strawberry and red bean. Each ice cream roll was made to order. Both ice cream rolls came out in perfect rolled shape. It also did not melt that fast too! Both ice cream rolls were creamy, smooth, and flavorful. I loved how the ice cream were not overly sweet. The toppings complemented both ice cream rolls perfectly. (PLUS, you can add more toppings to your roll as they have unlimited toppings.) They were refreshing, delicious and perfect for a nice warm day in SF. I'll definitely be back here when I have ice cream rolls craving. :)
author: Philana C.

description: Love this new rolled ice cream! Definitely would recommend going to try this even though it is far! Love the flavors they have and the place is super cute!
author: Tiffany C.

description: I just so happen to be in the neighborhood and wanted to try them out. I ended up getting the Mango Mousse drink. The cost was a bit pricey ($5) but it's what I'd like to say a speciality drink and a treat. I wouldn't get one everyday since that would be such a total waste. I would go back to try something new. Definitely worth a try.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
This takes the smashed up cooked-in-front-of-your-eyes Cold Stone concept to the next level. Pouring milky ice cream in liquid form onto a cold stainless steel surface, the ice cream and its mix-ins are crushed, stirred, and folded over and over again. The resulting mix is smeared evenly across the countertop in front of your eyes and sits for awhile (allowing you to set up the perfect instagram story documentation) and cools until it hardens into ice cream form. They then carefully scrape the ice cream into 5 rolls and then put them into a bowl before adding toppings. Super awesome perk - toppings are free! Choose from chocolate shavings, cheescake bits, mochi, and/or fresh fruit. Luckily I was the only person in the store at the time, so there was no wait, but I imagine the line could get pretty long if they're busy since each roll takes at least 5 min to make since the liquid has to set for awhile, and there's only 2 countertops made for the rolling. 

Strawberry cheesecake + fresh fruit + mochi 4/5: solid strawberry ice cream, definitely more flavorful once the rolls melt a bit. Topped with a ton of fresh fruit and chunks of cheesecake, this was a great concoction, not too sweet. Mochi was kind of chewy and harder than I'd have liked, but maybe this changes from day to day.

Chocolate sundae 3.5/5: with the chocolate whipped cream and chocolate shavings, this was a little bit too rich for me. Would have opted for some other toppings to mix in, but nothing on the menu sounded like it would have made for a good match - except more chocolate shavings.

The novelty of this ice cream made this super exciting for me, but the people who work there definitely expect you to Snapchat, Instagram, and further document their ice cream rolling. They were even filming their rolling technique when they made my ice cream. There's a corner for you to photograph your ice cream rolls in front of a white backdrop with their hashtag #steepup. Perfect setup for all your social media needs. 

Super clean, super modern, will be back for the milk tea drinks, hoping this is a solid SOMA boba joint as well.
author: Kathy T.

description:
This place is right by my office so I probably go here too often now. I went originally because it's the perfect combo of boba (which I can't get enough of) and something new I figured I should try (ice cream rolls). They're not really that different from regular ice cream as the rolls start to melt pretty quickly, but it's fun for a moment. I just love the feeling that they're turning the milk tea into ice cream, which may or may not be the method, but the flavor of tea is definitely as strong as it is in properly brewed milk tea. And I LOVE tea flavors in ice cream! It's fun to have so many to try here.

I wasn't a big fan of the pistachio, which was disappointing as that's also often one of my go-to favorites. HOWEVER, the Thai tea is total winner. And the special they had for taro is that rare flavorful taro that's not relying too heavily on sweetness to carry it.

Not the friendliest bunch, but orders come out quickly enough. Just make sure you get your extra free toppings if you order them as they sometimes miss adding them to the already full bowl. When mochi is a free topping, it's really sad when you've already left and realize you didn't get any :(
author: Shawna S.

description: I had never tried rolled ice cream prior to STEEP, but it was delicious! I ordered coffee with mochi for a topping. It was $8. The coffee ice cream rolls came with some waffle bits which gave the ice cream a nice little crunch. I'm not sure if I'll ever get rolled ice cream again, but I'm glad my first experience was at STEEP.
author: Nasrin R.

description: It was my first time to come to this ice cream store, and I love it! I chose myThai ice cream roll and my friend chose Oolong, both tasted good. Recommended!
author: Jenny M.

description: Good but nothing super special. I got the Thai tea with bob at 25% sweetness. It was plentyyyy sweet, I can't imagine who would ever order 50-125% sweetness. The interior was cute but really small and I couldn't find napkins anywhere, which was weird.
author: Sara T.

description: What we finally have rolled ice cream in SF??? Yes that's right so you better roll over here. I've been waiting for this day to come since rolled ice cream is such a big thing in SoCal and other parts of the Bay Area. It was about time SF brought rolled ice cream and STEEP did that. Steep usually serves drinks/pitaya/acai bowls but now they expanded to tea infused rolled ice cream. Their new location is in a really quiet area as well as it being hidden. Their menu don't have many flavors yet since all their flavors are supposed to be "tea infused." I got the oolong rolls since I never had milk tea flavored ice cream before which sounded really interesting. They have three ice cream machines but they were kind of understaffed during the time I went. Upside is that this week only, you can add as many toppings you want at no additional cost. Steep's boba never disappoints and their homemade grass jelly & coconut pudding is amazing. They even have a little booth for you to give the food a photo shoot which I think is another step up for Steep. Come and give the oolong a try, it's so good you might even get another one after.
author: Lisa W.

description: Interesting ice cream and tea shop - came here with a friend to try out their rolled ice cream. I ordered their matcha ice cream, which came with some blueberries and strawberries and some mochi bits. The concept of the rolled ice cream was very interesting, and the flavor of the matcha was decent, but I guess I'm just not used to the hard texture of the ice cream and prefer  softer and fluffier ice cream. Also adding the fruits felt a bit off and the flavors didn't mix well with the matcha. Overall a decent try. The price is pretty expensive ($6 per cup) for what you get.
author: Alvin W.

description: Amazing ice cream created in a very unique fashion (with names of dishes any developer would love). Try the C++ w/ fresh berries! 10/10 - would recommend.
author: Daniel B.

description: Ice cream isn't very good and the boba addon was vile. It was fun to watch them make it, but the end product wasn't worth the effort.
author: D K.

description: Pretty disappointed with their Jasmine milk tea. Seriously lacked the pleasant, floral scent and taste that makes jasmine milk tea so amazing. The tea taste was strong, but on the bitter side. The sweetness was uneven... strikingly sweet in the beginning and the end. The boba texture left some to be desired... it was too hard in the middle. Overall, definitely have had better jasmine milk tea in the city. I'd still give it a chance with roasted oolong tea, but overall, I think this place invests much more in their rolled ice cream, which I still need to check out.
author: Ke C.

description: I ordered cookie crush ice cream roll. The ice cream was ok but let it melt a little before you eat it
author: Cameron M.

description:
I guess most reviews here are about their ice cream rolls? But for me, I tried it (elsewhere) and never got into that hype. So, I ended up just getting tea instead. 

I really love Earl Grey so I ended up getting the Earl Grey lavender latte since it was cold and rainy that day. I also got a Honey Green Tea for my friend. Both drinks were delicious. I do wish the Earl Grey was a little stronger though. But it was still very good and it definitely earned me up. The Honey Green Tea was refreshing and tasty. 

Overall, great spot for a quick boba/tea fix. I guess I'll try their ice cream rolls next time?
author: Wendy Y.

description: Very cool and nice place to chill and eat some ice cream. Never had rolled icecream before and this was definitely a good place for first timers. Highly recommended.
author: Tina L.

description: Went here on the way home from the city.  I was finally able to experience the notorious ice cream rolls that you see all over social media.  For what you get, it also isn't too expensive.  We were also able to find parking fairly easily.
author: Madelyn N.

description: Really good. Good ingredients and nice photo booth for food. Cookie crush is the way to goooooo! Icicles in SJ is like a 2 hr wait! Just come here before it gets too popular.
author: Andrew E.

description: This place is poppin!!!! On this visit I ordered the milk green tea and their oolong ice cream -both were amazing. Ice cream rolls were on point and the toppings they suggest just works. The tea is high quality, the taste is just right, not overwhelming and none of that watered down BS you get at just about any other boba spot. Their boba balls are delectable. Every ball has just the right chew with a hint of sweetness, it is so beautifully balanced as if they handcraft each boba individually which is out of this world but isn't totally unbelievable considering the thought and attention that's demonstrably given to everything from the warmth of their lighting to the way the sugar packets are organized -these people know what they're doing and they do it right. I also love that they are a small, San Francisco-based shop run by hardworking locals
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I came here for the rolled ice cream but have been coming back for the milk tea. Don't know if I'm sold on the rolled ice cream novelty - it was cool watching them make it and it is nice treat, but I guess I prefer the traditional scoops of ice cream. Good to try at least once though! Some yelpers complain about the price but I think it's reasonable considering the quality ingredients they use and the free extra toppings.

I've been here a few times already just for milk tea. I just get the plain black with boba and less sugar. Boba is on point - soft and chewy. I'll have to try their other drinks next time. I'm happy that there's a decent dessert place in the neighborhood now.
author: Zell C.

description: Their strawberry cheesecake rolled ice cream just melts in your mouth. Portion sizes are huge, as the ice cream is a little pricey. But definitely go - its an ice cream making experience and an amazing dessert place!
author: Tejas G.

description:
Delicious boba tea and ice cream. My favorites are the Coffee Milk Tea with cream top 50% sweet and Earl grey lavender 25% sweet (no caffeine) all with boba. Definitely recommend making a trip here. Can't wait to try the ice cream when it's warmer. 

Just wish they were open earlier on the weekends!
author: Katie B.

description: Finally tried this place. Earl Grey Latte was good, not too sweet, just how I like it. They also have rolled ice cream with unique flavors. Will try that next time around when in the city again.
author: Rose T.

description: I tried icicles before, compare with icicles, I prefer icicles than steep. But considering in san francisco, steep is good choice to give it try.  highly recommend to try rolling ice cream, Uji matcha is okay level, the milk-taste is heavy, covered matcha flavor.
author: Faye L.

description: definitely came here for the snapchat and insta post and doesn't hurt that I am a HUGE ice cream person as well! I got the thai rolled ice cream and my boyfriend got the cookies and cream rolled ice cream and a honey green tea. The tea was definitely the best thing we had and I highly recommend it. The ice creams were great but definitely better for the insta! Will definitely be back though to try more of the teas and ice cream :)
author: Rachel N.

description: (4.5 stars) They have three vegan options and non-dairy milks (+.50) for their milkteas. They have a vegan roll up ice cream thing that is coconut based with mango and some other toppings; I think that's the first vegan option for rolled up ice cream I've found! They also have these two drinks: mango purée + coconut milk + raw sugar and taro +coconut milk + raw sugar. I got the mango one with boba and 75% sweetness and it was veryyyy sweet...(maybe because the boba is sweetened) so I would get 50% or even 25% next time! Anyways, cool interior and friendly service. If you take the N metro all the way to Brannan st, it's just a few minutes walk to STEEP!
author: Erika W.

description: We ordered the oolong ice cream and green tea ice cream.  Both were excellent in a way that they taste like they are supposed to.  Woman behind the counter was very nice.  The place has high ceilings and was clean. Hopefully they can keep up the quality. So glad this place is walking distance from my place because it's hard to find boba tea in the area.  They were also very nice to my dog.  He got a dog treat.
author: Urban E.

description: Good vibe, limited seating. But it's always fun to watch roll up ice cream. If you ask nicely, they can add fresh fruit with no additional charge to your ice cream:)
author: Emily L.

description: Their taro drink is not fresh, they are made with sweetened taro paste. Even when I ordered 0% sugar, it tasted like 150% sugar. I asked them to make it less sweet but they said they couldn't do anything because the paste is sweet. Don't write that it's fresh if it is pre-made paste. I wasted $6 on this.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Pros: Ice cream itself is not  sweet. Generous toppings. Clean environment.

Cons: All they did was just pouring the ice cream base onto the freezing slab and rolling it. Then, they added toppings ON TOP of the ice cream rolls. I expected ice cream base+ toppings being chopped and mixed well on the slab and rolled, just like how you and I saw on the viral ice rolls videos! Hello-- this makes your ice cream rolls not so different from what other regular ice cream shops do! What's the point of getting ice cream rolls if you aren't going to mix toppings on the slab? If they change the way of making ice cream rolls and they do it RIGHT, I am willing to visit again, though.
author: Amelia S.

description: I ordered My Thai which Thai ice tea flavored ice cream roll.  It comes with boba, homemade coconut pudding, and a free topping.  I added strawberries.  Really friendly staff and clean chic little place.  They have a little photo shoot set up for your ice cream rolls.  I will come back to try other flavors.
author: Klo H.

description: Nice little place. The earl grey milk tea snow rolls are really good though I don't think I would've put fruit topping on it. The strawberry tea is quite refreshing but not very sweet. The matcha strawberry lemonade has an extremely strong lemonade flavor though. Couldn't taste anything else.
author: Gayle Q.

description: I got the matcha with red bean and it was pretty good. Although the more I think about it I don't think I tasted much tea ? Anyways I think the service was friendly too. It's located in a hipster neighborhood. I feel hip.
author: Vincent L.

description: Soooo good! I've been craving this type of ice cream for months now after watching so many videos of it online. And after visiting San Francisco, I found this place and I'm so happy that I did! We ordered the Thai tea and coffee crush - both amazing!
author: Andrea C.

description: Very good milk tea (black) at 50% sugar. Their tofu pudding is an interesting topping: a bit crumbly, but tastes great, and the texture is nice in milk tea. I also tried their matcha rolled ice cream, which tasted fine but was just too tough for my taste---the opposite side of the ice cream texture spectrum from, say, the matcha soft serve at Uji in Japantown.
author: Blake A.

description: So glad I found this place! My friend and stopped by here on a Saturday night after dinner. The matcha rolled ice cream was very refreshing - not too sweet and didn't taste powdery. It came with massive amounts of fresh strawberries and red bean as toppings. Steep is less than a 10 min walk from the Caltrain station and I would highly recommend anyone to stop by for a quick snack
author: Sherrie Y.

description: Fun for kids to watch them make the ice cream. Love the free toppings (who doesn't want mochi in ice cream). Very generous portions. In the end, the texture is not as creamy as I like, but it's still good ice cream (very Asian focused flavors like Thai tea, matcha, black sesame).
author: B. Y.

description: Affordable boba shop just opened up by my apt! So excited as there aren't a ton of good food options around to begin with. Service is great, had the rolled ice cream and boba and it was all delicious! Worth a try
author: Holly M.

description: I was really intrigued by their ice cream rolls so I tried the root beer special - yummy!  I liked the unique whipped cream on top, although I wasn't sure how to eat the ice cream rolls (whether to pick up with my hand or try to cut it with spoon).  Eating was a little tricky although when it started to melt was much easier to eat.  Would like to be able to mix and match ice cream flavors (half & half flavors) so hopefully they will do that in the future.  I also ordered the organic honey chrysanthemum iced tea and to be honest it tasted medicine-like so wasn't a huge fan of this tea.
author: Terrie R.

description: My friends and I agreed that the strawberry cheesecake flavor is the best one!!! I also tried the thai tea one and the oolong one. My group and I didn't love the Thai tea flavor - it tastes exactly like the drink but it just didn't mix well with the toppings she got. The oolong one was good too - it REALLY tastes just like the tea!
author: Sophia L.

description: Pretty bland not worth the trip. Service was good and it was crowded but eh no thanks
author: Chanell S.

description: Good value ($6) and good flavor-got the pistachio one. Can't wait to come back to try uji matcha. Also love that we got there around 9pm on Saturday and there was no line. Hated that I had to wait about 1 hour at Icicles in San Jose for the same thing.
author: Mengyuan G.

description: Have tried it a couple of times now...and it's meh.  The boba is just a touch undercooked. The flavors are not as intense as at other places.  And though it looks nice because it's so new, I've walked in and there's boxes piled up against the walls and drink prep area is not that clean.  Hopefully these are just start up issues cause they're so close to my work!
author: Monica K.

description: Cool concept and great toppings! It's a little pricey but worth the experience. Much creamier ice cream than you'd expect.
author: Maegan P.

description: Love the options that they have for their ice cream toppings! Boba, grass jelly, mochi and coconut pudding!?! Their ice cream was also really good. I was going to say the only downside is that they close early (was 7PM I think) but I just noticed that they extended their hours!!!
author: Karen D.

description: STEEP Creamery and Tea, not to be confused with STEEP on Ritch St, is a small, clean, modern chill spot for your ice cream and boba fix.  If you're really into ice cream that tastes like the real Thai tea, matcha, oreo, and black sesame, I would recommend coming here.  It's not as sweet as usual ice cream.  They hand roll the ice cream in front of you, and although it doesn't look like much, it is enough to get by ;).  I give this place four stars for their ice cream taking on authentic flavors, since it isn't like the usual green tea or Thai tea mixed with vanilla.  Sometimes they have specialty flavors like.peanut butter toffee, and on their current menu strawberry cheesecake. Unlimited toppings!  You can actually taste the flavors, and... It doesn't melt too fast, so enjoy. I would definitely come here to try the other flavors, but for me it might be a one hit wonder kind of place.  Nonetheless it's worth coming to try all the flavors and you'll see that they use actual ingredients (strawberry preserves in your strawberry cheesecake).
author: Janet T.

description: Love love the matcha flavored ice cream! Flavor is on point. My boyfriend ordered the cereal flavor (I forgot the name) and it was good too, tasted like capn' crunch. You can also add toppings that are listed in their menu for free. The price for the rolled ice cream is $6.
author: Rachel A.

description: I'd have to say this is one of the best ice cream spots around the city.  You have to try the my Thai!!
author: Vivien K.

description: Majorly disappointed . My jasmine milk tea was water downed and bland. And for $6 bucks ? No thank you. I'll give a star for how clean and nice the place looks though.
author: Phuong V.

description: Not really sure how this place has 4.5 stars. Ordered a mango fruit tea from here to try it out. They say they it has mango purée in it but the tea is bland and tasteless. I was expecting somewhat of a smoothie texture, but it looked like there was maybe 2 drops of purée inside. The coconut pudding add on also looked and tasted like it was tofu in my tea. Bland. If you like tasteless bland tea, you'll love this place.
author: Kelvin T.

description: This is a very sweet small shop. The employees are very kind, warm hearted and friendly. The ice cream and tea were very delicious. If you are looking for a cute, casual spot for a treat, with kind and curious employees, this is the place for you. I would highly recommend visiting Steep Creamery & Tea.
author: Kylie J.

description:
I had the MyThai ice cream rolls and the Earl Grey Lavender milk tea. I didn't care for the coconut pudding in the MyThai as I'm not a huge fan of coconut however the ice cream was delicious. 

The Earl Grey Lavender milk tea was disgusting and I almost spat it out because the lavender was so strong.
author: Laura G.

description: It's good. Not a lot of flavors but good if you like teas. Only bad part is the wait. Ordering is quick, but waiting for your rolled ice cream is painful. There was no line to order, but a long long que to wait for your order. Waited 30 min to get it.
author: Juliet S.

description: Not bad! It was my first time trying this ice cream trend. I got the My Thai--3 rolls of Thai tea ice cream with some kind of jelly/pudding and a LOT of boba. I got the free toppings mochi and cheesecake bits. Total came out to $6.00. My friend got the Cookies and cream one which also had 3 rolls of ice cream, mini Oreos, and whipped cream. Found metered street parking on a Wednesday afternoon, and there were a lot of people waiting when we got there. It's a small place--no tables, just a couple benches and some stools.
author: Shar Y.

description: I've only tried the boba and the mango tea so my five stars for those two gems. It's right under our building so it's really hard to resist.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
Yum! For those that like to taste TEA  in their boba, this is the place for you. 

One star off for how long it takes for them to roll ice cream. Delicious though ;)
author: Vivian L.

description: It was worth a try, but I don't think I'll come back. The whole vibe from the environment and the staff was just, cold. The place is in an office building and didn't look like it was meant for food service. The most flavorful ice cream was the oolong. The customer service could be better; it seems like no one smiles--like no one actually likes working there.
author: Sav D.

description: I got the cookie crush with cheesecake bites and dark chocolate, and let me say it was amazing. A fun dessert for all to eat and just as delicious. If you want a great sweet bite this is the spot.
author: Aneal V.

description: I love this place so much I go there pretty much every single day of the week! They remember my name and they remember my order! Their drinks has always been really good, and the quality never changes, which means you get an amazon drink every single time! Their ice cream is also really good, the strawberry cheese back ice cream has tiny bits of cheese cake inside! Try their matcha red bean milk tea, and their uji matcha ice cream!
author: Annie L.

description: Steep creamery is pretty decent. Tried their Thai tea and their Taro ice cream rolls. Very decent amount and the ice cream is really good especially when it is on a hot day, it's very amazing when you add milk tea a long with it too. OH YEAH! Don't forget to add mochi and fruits! That is the best part of the rolled ice cream! So why 4 stars? The line is way to long and there was only 2 people working that day. Other than that, I love this place a lot.
author: Clayton L.

description: Yay rolled ice cream! I've had rolled ice cream at other places that just kind of taste like regular ice cream. I got the oolong flavor here and it's got va really good tea flavor. The ice cream was a little harder compared to others so it gives it a bite vs just tasting like regular ice cream. I was worried the toppings would be hard, but the boba and grass jelly was really good with it. The drink was ok though, they had crystal boba though which I've been craving a lot lately. I'd come back if I'm in the area!
author: Katherine T.

description: Probably more known as an ice cream place, but my first order here was the Earl Grey Lavender milk tea with crystal boba. I'm usually super pumped about lavender flavored things, but can't say I'd recommend this drink since it tastes like lavender detergent with a tinge of the bitterness from milk tea. Maybe the ice cream is more exciting.
author: Sharlene T.

description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood.  The shop is very clean and it is fun to watch the ice cream being rolled.  I tried the cookies and cream flavor, with some fruit topping.  Very good!
author: Katie E.

description: I was a big fan of their first location, but to add some more specialty drinks AND rolled ice cream? I count resist but go during day 1 of soft opening. The rolled ice cream was delicious. I got the matcha with the strawberries chopped into the ice cream. Will be back soon
author: Emily L.

description: Delicious rolled ice cream- fresh and intense tasting. Toppings were yummy, too! I'm worried for my waistline now, as this is very close to home. Next time, I'm getting boba milk tea.
author: Nivy G.
